tools.tool_description: Send and receive AI-generated responses using a variety of models for conversational tasks. Integrate with OpenRouter.ai to process messages and retrieve outputs efficiently.

messages.description: An array of conversation messages with roles and content

role.description: The role of the message sender

model.description: The model to use (e.g., "google/gemini-2.0-flash-thinking-exp:free", "undi95/toppy-m-7b:free"). If not provided, uses the default model if set.

tools.tool_description: Verify the validity of a model ID using OpenRouter MCP Server to ensure compatibility and correct integration with AI models.

servers.server_description: xml.Revit.MCP provides a comprehensive set of tools for integrating with Autodesk Revit through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). This library serves as a bridge between AI assistants and Revit, enabling powerful automation capabilities and programmatic interaction with building models.
servers.server_summary: A Python package that enables integration with Autodesk Revit through the Model Context Protocol, allowing users to send commands to Revit and automate interactions with building models.

tools.tool_description: Highlight and center specified elements in Revit views using JSON-RPC 2.0. Supports batch operations, auto-scaling, strict parameter validation, and detailed error handling for precise element visualization.

Create multiple floors in Revit with automated unit conversion, floor type matching, and error handling. Supports batch creation of structural and non-structural floors based on boundary points and elevation.
Generate floor plan views from specified levels in Revit using JSON-RPC 2.0. Automates bulk creation, skips duplicates, and includes error handling for efficient model management.
Automate room label creation in specified Revit plan views, skipping already labeled rooms, and returning detailed results in JSON-RPC 2.0 format for efficient project management.
Generate and manage duct systems in Revit by specifying dimensions, coordinates, and types. Automates unit conversion, type matching, and handles bulk creation for efficient workflow integration.
Execute Revit functions by specifying names and parameters in JSON-RPC 2.0 format. Supports batch calls, parameter validation, and robust error handling to automate building model interactions.
Retrieve currently selected elements in Revit UI, providing detailed data like ID, name, and category in JSON-RPC 2.0 format, with built-in error handling.

Link local DWG drawings to the current Revit project and activate a specified view using JSON-RPC 2.0 protocol. Automates parameter validation and ensures error handling for efficient workflow integration.

servers.server_description: Tripo MCP provides an interface between AI assistants and Tripo AI via Model Context Protocol (MCP).
servers.server_summary: Provides an interface between AI assistants and Tripo AI via Model Context Protocol, enabling generation of 3D assets from natural language and importing them to Blender.

tools.tool_description: Download Polyhaven assets (HDRI, textures, models) for Blender. Specify asset ID, type, resolution, and format to import directly.
Remove a specific object from a Blender scene by specifying its name using this tool included in the Tripo MCP Server interface.
Check PolyHaven integration status in Blender to verify availability of PolyHaven features via the Tripo MCP Server.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific object within a Blender scene by specifying its name, enabling precise asset management and integration with the Tripo MCP server.
Define or assign materials to 3D objects using specified color values or material names. Enables precise customization of object textures within the Tripo MCP Server environment.
Import GLB models directly into Blender scenes by providing the model's URL. Simplifies 3D asset integration for streamlined workflows. Returns the operation's result message.

Check the status of a 3D model generation task initiated by create_3d_model_from_text. Use the task_id to monitor progress, determine completion, or identify failures such as CANCELLED, FAILED, BANNED, or EXPIRED.
Apply a Polyhaven texture to a 3D object by specifying the object name and texture ID. Enables precise texture mapping for enhanced 3D asset customization within Blender.

servers.server_description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI agents to interact with Alchemy's blockchain APIs in a structured way. This allows agents to query blockchain data directly without writing any code.
servers.server_summary: The Alchemy MCP Server enables AI agents to interact with Alchemy's blockchain APIs for querying and retrieving blockchain data across multiple networks.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve real-time cryptocurrency prices using token symbols via the Alchemy MCP Server. Input an array of symbols like ["BTC", "ETH"] to access current market values.

symbols.description: A list of blockchaintoken symbols to query. e.g. ["BTC", "ETH"]

tools.tool_description: Retrieve token prices by specifying contract addresses and blockchain networks using Alchemy MCP Server for accurate and real-time pricing data.

addresses.description: A list of token contract address and network pairs

address.description: The token contract address to query. e.g. "0x1234567890123456789012345678901234567890"

network.description: The blockchain network to query. e.g. "eth-mainnet" or "base-mainnet"

tools.tool_description: Retrieve historical token price data by specifying a symbol, time range, and interval using Alchemy MCP Server for accurate analysis.

endTime.description: The end time date to query. e.g. "2021-01-01"

interval.description: The interval to query. e.g. "1d" or "1h"

startTime.description: The start time date to query. e.g. "2021-01-01"

symbol.description: The token symbol to query. e.g. "BTC" or "ETH"

tools.tool_description: Retrieve historical price data for specified tokens within defined time frames and intervals, supporting both structured queries and natural language inputs for flexible analysis.

interval.description: The interval to query. e.g. "1d" or "1h"

symbol.description: The token symbol to query. e.g. "BTC" or "ETH"

timeFrame.description: Time frame like "last-week", "past-7d", "ytd", "last-month", etc. or use natural language like "last week"

useNaturalLanguageProcessing.description: If true, will interpret timeFrame as natural language

tools.tool_description: Retrieve tokens owned by wallet addresses across multiple blockchain networks using specified address and network pairs for comprehensive asset tracking.

addresses.description: A list of wallet address and network pairs

networks.description: The blockchain networks to query. e.g. ["eth-mainnet", "base-mainnet"]

tools.tool_description: Retrieve blockchain transfer data by specifying block range, addresses, contracts, and categories. Use to query transaction details, filter by value, and paginate results efficiently within the Alchemy MCP Server.

category.description: The category of transfers to query. e.g. "external" or "internal"

excludeZeroValue.description: Whether to exclude zero value transfers.

fromAddress.description: The wallet address to query the transfer was sent from.

fromBlock.description: The block number to start the search from. e.g. "1234567890". Inclusive from block (hex string, int, latest, or indexed).

maxCount.description: The maximum number of results to return. e.g. "0x3E8".

network.description: The blockchain network to query. e.g. "eth-mainnet" or "base-mainnet").

order.description: The order of the results. e.g. "asc" or "desc".

pageKey.description: The cursor to start the search from. Use this to paginate through the results.

toAddress.description: The wallet address to query the transfer was sent to.

toBlock.description: The block number to end the search at. e.g. "1234567890". Inclusive to block (hex string, int, latest, or indexed).

withMetadata.description: Whether to include metadata in the results.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve and analyze transaction history for specified wallet addresses across multiple blockchain networks. Use pagination to manage large datasets and filter results by network for targeted insights.

addresses.description: A list of wallet address and network pairs

networks.description: The blockchain networks to query. e.g. ["eth-mainnet", "base-mainnet"]

after.description: The cursor that points to the next set of results. Use this to paginate through the results.

before.description: The cursor that points to the previous set of results. Use this to paginate through the results.

limit.description: The number of results to return. Default is 25. Max is 100

tools.tool_description: Query and retrieve NFTs owned by multichain wallet addresses across specified blockchain networks, with customizable filters for spam and other attributes.

addresses.description: A list of wallet address and network pairs

excludeFilters.description: The filters to exclude from the results. e.g. ["SPAM", "AIRDROPS"]

includeFilters.description: The filters to include in the results. e.g. ["SPAM", "AIRDROPS"]

networks.description: The blockchain networks to query. e.g. ["eth-mainnet", "base-mainnet"]

spamConfidenceLevel.description: The spam confidence level to query. e.g. "LOW" or "HIGH"

pageKey.description: The cursor to start the search from. Use this to paginate through the results.

pageSize.description: The number of results to return. Default is 100. Max is 100

withMetadata.description: Whether to include metadata in the results.

servers.server_description: A single source for integrating AI Agents with the Crypto ecosystem. This includes Wallet creation and management, swaps, transfers, event-based trades like DCA, stop loss and take profit, and much more. The Armor MCP supports Solana in Alpha and, when in beta, will support more than a dozen blockchains, including Ethereum. Base, Avalanche, Bitcoin, Sui, Berachain, megaETH, Optimism, Ton, BNB, and Arbitrum, among others. Using Armor's MCP you can bring all of crypto into your AI Agent with unified logic and a complete set of tools.
servers.server_summary: An MCP server providing unified access to blockchain operations, bridging, swapping, and crypto trading strategies for AI agents.

tools.tool_description: Add multiple wallets to a specific group using the group name and a list of wallet names. Simplifies blockchain wallet management on the Armor Crypto MCP server.
Retrieve details for a specific wallet group on the Armor Crypto MCP server by providing the group name as a parameter. Streamlines access to blockchain operations for AI agents.
Restore archived wallets on Armor Crypto MCP by providing a list of wallet names. Simplifies access to inactive wallets for blockchain operations and strategies.
Retrieve the token balances for specified wallet/token pairs. Input a list of dictionaries containing 'wallet' and 'token' keys to fetch balances efficiently.
Execute crypto swap transactions by processing a list of swap requests. Part of Armor Crypto MCP, enabling unified blockchain operations and trading strategies for AI agents.
Retrieve and display all wallet groups in the Armor Crypto MCP server, enabling efficient management and organization of blockchain wallet collections for AI agents.
Archive specified wallets on the Armor Crypto MCP server by providing a list of wallet names. Simplify blockchain operations for crypto trading strategies.
Remove specified wallets from a designated group within Armor Crypto MCP. Input includes group name and a list of wallet names to manage blockchain operations efficiently.

servers.server_description: This is an MCP server for the Base network. It allows LLMs to perform blockchain operations on the Base network through natural language commands, including wallet management, balance checking, and transaction execution.
servers.server_summary: An MCP server that enables LLMs to perform blockchain operations on the Base network through natural language commands, including wallet management, balance checking, and transaction execution.

tools.tool_description: Generate a new wallet on the Base Network MCP Server to manage blockchain operations, with an optional name for identification. Facilitates wallet creation for seamless integration with decentralized applications.
Verify wallet balances on the Base network by specifying a wallet name or address. Use this tool to retrieve accurate balance information for blockchain wallet management.

wallet.description: Wallet name or address (defaults to primary wallet)

tools.tool_description: Retrieve a list of all available wallets on the Base Network MCP Server to manage blockchain operations, check balances, and execute transactions efficiently.

servers.server_description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Binance market data with WebSocket support.
servers.server_summary: A server implementation that streams real-time Binance market data (spot and futures) via WebSockets, enabling applications to receive and process cryptocurrency market information through the Model Context Protocol.

tools.tool_description: Subscribe to real-time Binance market data for spot and futures, including tickers, trades, klines, and order book depth, by specifying trading pairs and data streams.

streams.description: List of data streams to subscribe to

type.description: Market type

tools.tool_description: Fetch real-time market data for trading pairs on Binance, including spot and futures, to monitor and analyze cryptocurrency markets efficiently.

type.description: Market type

tools.tool_description: Retrieve the current funding rate for a specified futures trading pair on Binance to monitor and manage risk in leveraged trading strategies.
Validate Binance futures API endpoints by testing specific trading pairs, ensuring accurate data retrieval and functionality for real-time market analysis.

servers.server_description: A collection of Bitcoin SV (BSV) tools for the Model Context Protocol (MCP) framework. This library provides wallet, ordinals, and utility functions for BSV blockchain interaction.
servers.server_summary: A collection of Bitcoin SV tools for the Model Context Protocol that enables AI assistants to interact with the BSV blockchain through wallet operations, ordinals (NFTs), and various blockchain utilities.

tools.tool_description: Discover and filter marketplace listings for Bitcoin SV ordinals, including NFTs, BSV-20, and BSV-21 tokens. Retrieve asset details, prices, and seller information with sorting and pagination options.

address.description: Bitcoin address

limit.description: Number of results (1-100, default 20)

sort.description: Sort method (recent, price, num, height, price_per_token)

tokenType.description: Type of token to search for (nft, bsv20, bsv21, or all)

tools.tool_description: Retrieve recent sales data for BSV-20 and BSV-21 tokens on the Bitcoin SV ordinals marketplace. Analyze market activity, track token sales, and filter results by ID, ticker, or seller address to gain insights into trends.

address.description: Bitcoin address

limit.description: Number of results (1-100, default 20)

tokenType.description: Type of token to search for (bsv20, bsv21, or all)

tools.tool_description: Fetch detailed BSV-20 token data by ID or ticker symbol using this Bitcoin SV tool. Verify authenticity, check supply metrics, and access token status for accurate blockchain insights.

id.description: BSV20 token ID in outpoint format (txid_vout)

tools.tool_description: Converts data between utf8, hex, base64, and binary formats for use in blockchain, encryption, or file processing. Requires source and target encoding parameters.

data.description: The data string to be converted

from.description: Source encoding format (utf8, hex, base64, or binary)

to.description: Target encoding format to convert to (utf8, hex, base64, or binary)

tools.tool_description: Fetch the current Bitcoin SV (BSV) price in USD to calculate transaction values, monitor market conditions, or convert between BSV and fiat currencies using real-time data from a reliable exchange API.

args.description: No parameters required - simply returns the current BSV price in USD

tools.tool_description: Access and analyze Bitcoin SV blockchain data such as chain stats, blocks, transactions, and addresses using the WhatsOnChain API. Specify the network (main or test) and required parameters for precise results.

address.description: Bitcoin address (required for address_history and address_utxos endpoints)

blockHeight.description: Block height (required for block_by_height and block_stats_by_height endpoints)

days.description: Number of days for miner stats endpoints (defaults to 7)

limit.description: Limit for paginated results (optional for address_history)

network.description: Network to use (main or test)

pageNumber.description: Page number for block_pages endpoint (defaults to 1)

txHash.description: Transaction hash (required for tx_by_hash, tx_raw, and tx_receipt endpoints)

txids.description: Array of transaction IDs for bulk_tx_details endpoint

tools.tool_description: Decode and analyze Bitcoin SV transactions to extract detailed details such as inputs, outputs, fees, scripts, and blockchain context. Accepts transaction IDs or raw data in hex/base64 encoding for comprehensive insights.

Retrieve detailed inscription data, including content type, file info, origin, and status, by specifying the outpoint. Use this tool to verify NFT authenticity or explore metadata of digital artifacts on the Bitcoin SV blockchain.

servers.server_description: CCXT MCP Server is a server that allows AI models to interact with cryptocurrency exchange APIs through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). This server uses the CCXT library to provide access to more than 100 cryptocurrency exchanges and their trading capabilities.
servers.server_summary: A server that allows AI models to interact with cryptocurrency exchange APIs through the Model Context Protocol, providing access to over 100 exchanges and their trading capabilities.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve all closed orders for a configured account on supported cryptocurrency exchanges. Use account name, optional filters like symbol, limit, or timestamp to fetch specific data.

accountName.description: Account name defined in the configuration file (e.g., 'bybit_main')

limit.description: Limit the number of orders returned (optional)

since.description: Timestamp in ms to fetch orders since (optional)

tools.tool_description: Retrieve real-time ticker data for a specified trading pair on a cryptocurrency exchange using the CCXT MCP Server. Input the exchange ID and symbol to access price, volume, and market info.
Retrieve personal trade history from cryptocurrency exchanges using a configured account. Specify account name, symbol, limit, and timestamp for precise data extraction.

accountName.description: Account name defined in the configuration file (e.g., 'bybit_main')

limit.description: Limit the number of trades returned (optional)

since.description: Timestamp in ms to fetch trades since (optional)

tools.tool_description: Retrieve all configured cryptocurrency exchange account names using the CCXT MCP Server, enabling streamlined API interactions across multiple exchanges.
Retrieve account balance for a configured cryptocurrency exchange account using the CCXT MCP Server. Specify the account name to access real-time financial data.

accountName.description: Account name defined in the configuration file (e.g., 'bybit_main')

tools.tool_description: Retrieve ticker data for all or specific trading pairs from a cryptocurrency exchange, enabling real-time market analysis and decision-making.

symbols.description: Optional list of specific symbols to fetch

tools.tool_description: Retrieve the order book for a specified trading symbol on a cryptocurrency exchange, including bid and ask orders, to analyze market depth and liquidity. Integrates with over 100 exchanges via the CCXT MCP Server.

limit.description: Limit the number of orders returned (optional)

tools.tool_description: Retrieve recent cryptocurrency trades for a specific trading pair and exchange. Specify symbol, exchange ID, and optional parameters like limit or timestamp to fetch precise trading data using the CCXT MCP Server.

limit.description: Limit the number of trades returned (optional)

since.description: Timestamp in ms to fetch trades since (optional)

servers.server_description: The MCP server that can read recent news from Coindesk.
servers.server_summary: The MCP server that can read recent news from Coindesk.

tools.tool_description: Extract structured news content from CoinDesk articles, including title, author, publication date, and full text, using a provided URL. Simplifies article retrieval and parsing for quick insights.

servers.server_description: A Model Completion Protocol (MCP) server for the Cryo blockchain data extraction tool.
servers.server_summary: An API server that implements the Model Completion Protocol (MCP) for Cryo blockchain data extraction, allowing users to query Ethereum blockchain data through any MCP-compatible client.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve a comprehensive list of available cryo datasets to query Ethereum blockchain data via the Cryo MCP Server API.
Retrieve detailed transaction data on the Ethereum blockchain using the transaction hash. The Cryo MCP Server tool enables precise blockchain data extraction for analysis or verification.

Retrieve detailed information about a specific dataset, including schema and available fields, by specifying its name and optional sample block parameters for Ethereum blockchain data on the Cryo MCP Server.
Query specific datasets from the Cryo MCP Server using block ranges, contract addresses, and output formats. Retrieve and filter blockchain data for analysis or integration.
Retrieve details of the newest Ethereum block, including block number, using the Cryo MCP Server for accurate blockchain data extraction.

servers.server_description: An MCP server that provides cryptocurrency project data from Mobula.io to AI agents.
servers.server_summary: The Crypto Projects MCP Server allows users to fetch and format cryptocurrency project data from Mobula.io for AI agents and LLMs.

tools.tool_description: Fetch detailed cryptocurrency project data by providing a token symbol. Retrieves raw JSON response from Mobula API for comprehensive insights into any crypto project.

servers.server_description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Ethereum blockchain.
servers.server_summary: Provides tools for AI assistants to interact with the Ethereum blockchain through standard JSON-RPC methods, enabling queries for account balances, gas prices, and smart contract code.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve smart contract or account code from an Ethereum address using specific block parameters. Designed for querying blockchain data via Ethereum RPC MCP Server.

address.description: The Ethereum address to get code from

tools.tool_description: Check the current balance of any Ethereum address using the Ethereum RPC MCP Server. Input the address and optional block parameter to retrieve precise account data.

address.description: The Ethereum address to check balance

tools.tool_description: Retrieve Ethereum blockchain logs based on specified filter criteria, such as contract address, block range, or event topics, for detailed transaction analysis.

address.description: Contract address or a list of addresses from which logs should originate

fromBlock.description: Block number in hex or "latest", "earliest" or "pending"

toBlock.description: Block number in hex or "latest", "earliest" or "pending"

tools.tool_description: Execute a call to a contract function without creating a transaction on the Ethereum blockchain. Use directly to query smart contract data, check execution outputs, or simulate transactions.

data.description: The compiled code of a contract OR the hash of the invoked method signature and encoded parameters

from.description: The address the transaction is sent from

gas.description: Integer of the gas provided for the transaction execution in hex

gasPrice.description: Integer of the gas price used for each paid gas in hex

to.description: The address the transaction is directed to

value.description: Integer of the value sent with this transaction in hex

tools.tool_description: Send transactions to the Ethereum network, specifying sender, recipient, gas, and data parameters for executing smart contracts or transferring value.

data.description: The compiled code of a contract OR the hash of the invoked method signature and encoded parameters

from.description: The address the transaction is sent from

gas.description: Integer of the gas provided for the transaction execution in hex

gasPrice.description: Integer of the gas price used for each paid gas in hex

nonce.description: Integer of a nonce used to prevent transaction replay

to.description: The address the transaction is directed to

value.description: Integer of the value sent with this transaction in hex

servers.server_description: A dynamic MCP server for interacting with Etherscan's API and services.
servers.server_summary: An MCP server that provides access to Etherscan blockchain data APIs, allowing users to query Ethereum blockchain information through natural language.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve a filtered list of RPC endpoints tailored to specific blockchain requirements, including chain ID, open-source status, and tracking preferences, using Etherscan MCP. Simplify RPC selection for Ethereum applications.

chain_id.description: The chain ID to get the RPC endpoints for

tracking.description: Filter by tracking (none, yes, limited, unspecified)

tools.tool_description: Retrieve the total number of token holders for a specific Ethereum token address using chain ID and token address inputs. Ideal for tracking token distribution on the Ethereum blockchain.
Retrieve the total supply of a token on the Ethereum blockchain by specifying its chain ID and token address using Etherscan MCP server.
Retrieve the balance of a specific token for a given Ethereum address, enabling users to monitor token holdings directly from the Ethereum blockchain.

address.description: The address to check the balance for

tools.tool_description: Retrieve token holder information by specifying a token address and chain ID using Etherscan MCP. Ideal for analyzing Ethereum blockchain token ownership and distribution.

servers.server_description: The EVM MCP Server enables seamless interaction with 30+ EVM-compatible blockchains (including Ethereum, Polygon, Arbitrum, Optimism), providing comprehensive blockchain services for AI agents through a unified interface
servers.server_summary: A Model Context Protocol server that enables AI agents to interact with 30+ Ethereum-compatible blockchain networks, providing services like token transfers, contract interactions, and ENS resolution through a unified interface.

tools.tool_description: Initiate state-changing smart contract functions on Ethereum-compatible blockchains. Specify contract details, ABI, function, and arguments, then sign and send transactions securely.

abi.description: The ABI (Application Binary Interface) of the smart contract function, as a JSON array

args.description: The arguments to pass to the function, as an array (e.g., ['0x1234...', '1000000000000000000'])

contractAddress.description: The address of the smart contract to interact with

functionName.description: The name of the function to call on the contract (e.g., 'transfer')

network.description: Network name (e.g., 'ethereum', 'optimism', 'arbitrum', 'base', 'polygon') or chain ID. Defaults to Ethereum mainnet.

privateKey.description: Private key of the sending account in hex format (with or without 0x prefix). SECURITY: This is used only for transaction signing and is not stored.

tools.tool_description: Authorize a DeFi protocol or exchange to spend your ERC20 tokens by specifying the token address, spender address, and amount. Essential for enabling token interactions in decentralized applications.

amount.description: The amount of tokens to approve in token units, not wei (e.g., '1000' to approve spending 1000 tokens). Use a very large number for unlimited approval.

network.description: Network name (e.g., 'ethereum', 'optimism', 'arbitrum', 'base', 'polygon') or chain ID. Defaults to Ethereum mainnet.

privateKey.description: Private key of the token owner account in hex format (with or without 0x prefix). SECURITY: This is used only for transaction signing and is not stored.

spenderAddress.description: The contract address being approved to spend your tokens (e.g., a DEX or lending protocol)

tokenAddress.description: The contract address of the ERC20 token to approve for spending (e.g., '0xA0b86991c6218b36c1d19D4a2e9Eb0cE3606eB48' for USDC on Ethereum)

tools.tool_description: Verify if an address is a smart contract or an externally owned account (EOA) on Ethereum and EVM-compatible networks using a unified interface.

address.description: The wallet or contract address or ENS name to check (e.g., '0x1234...' or 'uniswap.eth')

network.description: Network name (e.g., 'ethereum', 'optimism', 'arbitrum', 'base', etc.) or chain ID. Supports all EVM-compatible networks. Defaults to Ethereum mainnet.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve a list of supported EVM networks through the EVM MCP Server, simplifying integration with 30+ Ethereum-compatible blockchains for token transfers, contract interactions, and ENS resolution.
Retrieve detailed information about any EVM-compatible network, including Ethereum, Optimism, Arbitrum, and Base. Specify the network name or chain ID using the EVM MCP Server.

network.description: Network name (e.g., 'ethereum', 'optimism', 'arbitrum', 'base', etc.) or chain ID. Supports all EVM-compatible networks. Defaults to Ethereum mainnet.

tools.tool_description: Convert ENS names like 'vitalik.eth' into Ethereum addresses using the EVM MCP Server. Works across 30+ blockchain networks, defaulting to Ethereum mainnet for optimal resolution.

network.description: Network name (e.g., 'ethereum', 'optimism', 'arbitrum', 'base', etc.) or chain ID. ENS resolution works best on Ethereum mainnet. Defaults to Ethereum mainnet.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve blockchain block details by specifying the block number and network using the EVM MCP Server. Supports Ethereum and other compatible networks for efficient data access.

network.description: Network name or chain ID. Defaults to Ethereum mainnet.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve the native token balance (ETH, MATIC, etc.) for a wallet address or ENS name across 30+ EVM-compatible networks using the EVM MCP Server.

address.description: The wallet address or ENS name (e.g., '0x1234...' or 'vitalik.eth') to check the balance for

network.description: Network name (e.g., 'ethereum', 'optimism', 'arbitrum', 'base', etc.) or chain ID. Supports all EVM-compatible networks. Defaults to Ethereum mainnet.

servers.server_description: This repository contains a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides Claude with access to Ethereum and EVM-compatible blockchain operations via ethers.js v5. The server enables Claude to perform operations like creating wallets, checking balances, sending transactions, and interacting with smart contracts on EVM-compatible blockchains.
servers.server_summary: Provides Claude with access to Ethereum and EVM-compatible blockchain operations, enabling wallet management, transaction handling, contract interactions, and blockchain queries through natural language.

tools.tool_description: Sign Ethereum or EVM-compatible blockchain transactions securely using a wallet's private key. Input transaction details to generate a signed transaction without broadcasting it to the network.

wallet.description: The wallet (private key, mnemonic, or JSON). If not provided, uses PRIVATE_KEY environment variable if set.

tools.tool_description: Generates a mnemonic phrase with a specified length for Ethereum and EVM-compatible wallets, supporting optional locale customization for secure seed creation.

length.description: The length of the mnemonic phrase

tools.tool_description: Sign a message using a wallet for Ethereum and EVM-compatible chains. Requires a message input and accepts a private key, mnemonic, or JSON wallet for secure message authentication.

wallet.description: The wallet (private key, mnemonic, or JSON). If not provided, uses PRIVATE_KEY environment variable if set.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve the current block number from Ethereum or EVM-compatible blockchains using MCP Crypto Wallet EVM for accurate blockchain status queries.

Initiate and send transactions on Ethereum and EVM-compatible blockchains using wallet credentials or environment variables. Input transaction details like recipient, gas limits, and values for secure execution.

wallet.description: The wallet (private key, mnemonic, or JSON). If not provided, uses PRIVATE_KEY environment variable if set.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve current network details from an EVM-compatible blockchain, enabling wallet management, transaction handling, and contract interactions with accurate network data.
Retrieve the balance of an Ethereum or EVM-compatible wallet by providing a private key, mnemonic, or JSON. Optionally specify a block tag to query the balance at a specific block.

wallet.description: The wallet (private key, mnemonic, or JSON). If not provided, uses PRIVATE_KEY environment variable if set.

tools.tool_description: Configure the RPC provider URL for Ethereum and EVM-compatible blockchain operations. Use this to specify custom endpoints for wallet management, transactions, and smart contract interactions.

servers.server_description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows LLM to interact with the blockchain through MetaMask.
servers.server_summary: A Model Context Protocol server that allows LLMs to interact with blockchain through MetaMask, keeping private keys securely in your crypto wallet while enabling transactions and blockchain operations.

tools.tool_description: Send blockchain transactions securely via MetaMask MCP, specifying recipient, value, gas fees, and chain ID for network compatibility.

chainId.description: Chain ID to validate against before sending transaction.

data.description: A contract hashed method call with encoded args.

maxFeePerGas.description: Total fee per gas in wei, inclusive of maxPriorityFeePerGas.

maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Max priority fee per gas in wei.

to.description: The transaction recipient or contract address.

value.description: Value in wei sent with this transaction.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve the most recent block number from a specified blockchain using the MetaMask MCP server, enabling secure and direct blockchain interactions without exposing private keys.

chainId.description: ID of chain to use when fetching data.

tools.tool_description: Securely sign messages using MetaMask MCP by inputting your desired string, ensuring blockchain interactions remain private and controlled within your crypto wallet.
Execute instant message calls to smart contracts or recipients without submitting transactions to the blockchain, using encoded data and specified values in wei.

data.description: A contract hashed method call with encoded args.

value.description: Value (in wei) sent with this transaction.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve the primary ENS name associated with an Ethereum address using MetaMask MCP. Specify the address, chain ID, and optional block number to fetch the name securely.

address.description: Address to get the name for.

blockNumber.description: Block number to get name at.

servers.server_description: This MCP (Model Context Protocol) server is designed to interact with the Monad testnet. servers.server_description: Sensei MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides expert guidance for Dojo and Cairo development on Starknet. Learn Dojo development basics with a beginner-friendly guide. Start new projects, understand workflows, and explore the Dojo architecture for building onchain worlds using Starknet.
Provides expert guidance for implementing Dojo systems and game logic, including contract functions, state changes, and World contract interactions, tailored for Cairo development on Starknet.
Get comprehensive guidance for Dojo and Cairo development on Starknet. This tool provides expert assistance for building onchain worlds using the Dojo Entity Component System framework.

This server provides an integration with the standardized, multi-chain Adamik API, allowing developers to seamlessly interact with diverse blockchains for transaction management, account insights, staking, and token interactions, all through a unified and enterprise-grade interface.

situation.description: The broader context for the use case
situation.title: Situation

task.description: Specific details on the forecasting or prediction task.
task.title: Task

tools.tool_description: Generate forecasts for values between 0 and 1 using a NormalizedForecaster agent. Provide session_id, input data model, and input data to receive predictions with text explanations, including support for files and text inputs.

description.title: Description

name.description: Field name. Should be a valid python variable name.
name.title: Name

type.description:
The type of the field. 
        ImageFromFile takes a single named-argument, 'file_path' as input which should be absolute path to the image to be included. So you should provide this input as json, eg. {'file_path': '/path/to/image'}.

forecast_start_dt_str.description: The datetime str in '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S' format of the first value in the forecast horizon.

horizon_len.description: The integer length of the forecast horizon. Eg., 60 if a 60 day forecast was requested.

input_data.description: The forecast inputs that you will pass to the chronulus agent to make the prediction. The keys of the dict should correspond to the InputField name you provided in input_fields.
input_data.title: Input Data

input_data_model.description: Metadata on the fields you will include in the input_data.

session_id.description: The session_id for the forecasting or prediction use case
session_id.title: Session Id

time_scale.description: The times scale of the forecast horizon. Valid time scales are 'hours', 'days', and 'weeks'.
time_scale.title: Time Scale

tools.tool_description: Generate forecasts for values between 0 and 1 using a NormalizedForecaster agent. Specify input data, forecast start date, time scale, and horizon length to receive predictions and text explanations. Integrates with Chronulus for AI-powered forecasting.

agent_id.description: The agent_id for the forecasting or prediction use case and previously defined input_data_model
agent_id.title: Agent Id

forecast_start_dt_str.description: The datetime str in '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S' format of the first value in the forecast horizon.

horizon_len.description: The integer length of the forecast horizon. Eg., 60 if a 60 day forecast was requested.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve a risk assessment scorecard in Markdown or JSON format to evaluate safety concerns or justify warnings for AI forecasting and prediction use cases on Chronulus MCP Server. Requires session_id.

as_json.description: If true, returns the scorecard in JSON format, otherwise returns a markdown formatted scorecard
as_json.title: As Json

session_id.description: The session_id for the forecasting or prediction use case
session_id.title: Session Id

tools.tool_description: Save forecast data and explanations from Chronulus AI as CSV and TXT files. Specify prediction ID, output path, and file names. Optionally rescale predictions for analysis and reference.

csv_name.description: The path where the CSV file should be saved. Should end in .csv
csv_name.title: Csv Name

invert_scale.description: Set this flag to true if the scale of the new units will run in the opposite direction from the inputs.
invert_scale.title: Invert Scale

output_path.description: The path where the CSV file should be saved. Should end in .csv
output_path.title: Output Path

prediction_id.description: The prediction_id from a prediction result
prediction_id.title: Prediction Id

txt_name.description: The name of the TXT file to be saved. Should end in .txt
txt_name.title: Txt Name

y_max.description: The expected largest value for the use case. E.g., for product sales, 0 would be the largest possible value would be given by the user or determined from this history of sales for the product in question or a similar product.
y_max.title: Y Max

y_min.description: The expected smallest value for the use case. E.g., for product sales, 0 would be the least possible value for sales.
y_min.title: Y Min

        ImageFromFile takes a single named-argument, 'file_path' as input which should be absolute path to the image to be included. So you should provide this input as json, eg. {'file_path': '/path/to/image'}.

servers.server_description:
Ingest anything from Slack, Discord, websites, Google Drive, email, Jira, Linear or GitHub into a Graphlit project - and then search and retrieve relevant knowledge within an MCP client like Cursor, Windsurf, Goose or Cline.

Documents (PDF, DOCX, PPTX, etc.) and HTML web pages will be extracted to Markdown upon ingestion. Audio and video files will be transcribed upon ingestion.

Web crawling and web search are built-in as MCP tools, with no need to integrate other tools separately.
servers.server_summary:
Ingest anything from Slack, Discord, websites, Google Drive, email, Jira, Linear or GitHub into a Graphlit project - and then search and retrieve relevant knowledge within an MCP client like Cursor, Windsurf, Goose or Cline.

Documents (PDF, DOCX, PPTX, etc.) and HTML web pages will be extracted to Markdown upon ingestion. Audio and video files will be transcribed upon ingestion.

Web crawling and web search are built-in as MCP tools, with no need to integrate other tools separately.

tools.tool_description: Transfer files from a SharePoint library or specific folder into the Graphlit knowledge base. Specify libraryId, optional folderId, and read limit for file quantity. Returns a feed identifier for asynchronous processing.

readLimit.description: Number of files to ingest, optional. Defaults to 100.

tools.tool_description: Streamline issue integration from Linear projects into Graphlit knowledge base. Specify project name and optional read limit for a controlled ingestion process, executed asynchronously with feed identifier return.

readLimit.description: Number of issues to ingest, optional. Defaults to 100.

tools.tool_description: Extract and ingest GitHub repository issues into the Graphlit knowledge base by specifying the repository owner, name, and optional read limit. Enables asynchronous issue management and data integration.

readLimit.description: Number of issues to ingest, optional. Defaults to 100.

tools.tool_description: Execute web searches for pages, podcasts, videos, images, news, or shopping using a query string. Choose search services like Tavily or Exa, and retrieve URL, title, and Markdown text from results without ingesting into Graphlit.
Ingest files from a OneDrive folder into a Graphlit knowledge base. Specify a read limit for file count, and receive a feed identifier for asynchronous processing.

readLimit.description: Number of files to ingest, optional. Defaults to 100.

tools.tool_description: Ingest messages from a Discord channel into a knowledge base, specifying the channel name and optional read limit. Executes asynchronously and returns the feed identifier for easy retrieval.

readLimit.description: Number of messages to ingest, optional. Defaults to 100.

tools.tool_description: Extract and ingest Reddit posts from specified subreddits into the Graphlit knowledge base. Specify a subreddit name and optional read limit to control the number of posts processed. Performs asynchronously and returns the feed identifier.

readLimit.description: Number of posts to ingest, optional. Defaults to 100.

tools.tool_description: Import Jira project issues into the Graphlit knowledge base. Specify the Jira server URL, project name, and optional read limit. Executes asynchronously and returns a feed identifier for tracking.

readLimit.description: Number of issues to ingest, optional. Defaults to 100.

servers.server_description: This repository contains a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server with tools that can access the OpenTelemetry traces and metrics you've sent to Logfire.
servers.server_summary: A Model Context Protocol server that enables LLMs to retrieve and analyze OpenTelemetry traces and metrics from Logfire, supporting exception tracking and custom SQL queries against telemetry data.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve the schema of Logfire records to understand data structure for executing custom SQL queries and analyzing OpenTelemetry traces and metrics.
Identify exceptions in Logfire telemetry data by specifying a time range up to 7 days. Analyze and retrieve error patterns using OpenTelemetry traces for effective troubleshooting.
Retrieve the 10 most recent exceptions from a specified file within a defined time frame. Useful for monitoring and debugging error occurrences in telemetry data.
Execute custom SQL queries on Logfire database to retrieve and analyze telemetry data, with a lookback period of up to 7 days for precise insights.

servers.server_description: This server enables integration with Claude Code/VSCode/Cursor (and other MCP-compatible clients), providing contextual information and functionality related to the Luno cryptocurrency exchange.
servers.server_summary: MCP Server for the Luno Cryptocurrency API, allowing trades to be made, orders and balances to be accessed

tools.tool_description: Cancel a specific cryptocurrency order by providing the order ID using the Luno MCP Server tool. Simplify trading operations and manage orders effectively.
Retrieve balances for all accounts associated with Luno Cryptocurrency API, enabling efficient monitoring of funds and financial positions.
Retrieve candlestick market data for specified trading pairs and durations. Inputs include pair, duration, and optional timestamp to filter historical data.

duration.description: Candle duration in seconds (e.g., 60 for 1m, 300 for 5m, 3600 for 1h)

since.description: Filter to candles starting on or after this timestamp (Unix milliseconds). Defaults to 24 hours ago.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve detailed information about supported cryptocurrency market pairs, including specific data like XBTZAR or ETHZAR, using the Luno MCP Server API.

pair.description: List of market pairs to return (e.g., XBTZAR,ETHZAR)

tools.tool_description: Retrieve the order book for a specified trading pair using the Luno MCP Server. Access buy and sell orders to analyze market depth and liquidity.
Retrieve real-time ticker data for specific cryptocurrency trading pairs on the Luno MCP Server to monitor market prices and trading activity.
Retrieve ticker data for specific currency pairs on the Luno MCP Server. Use this tool to access market information for trading and analysis purposes.

pair.description: Return tickers for multiple markets (e.g., XBTZAR,ETHZAR)

tools.tool_description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific cryptocurrency transaction using the account ID and transaction ID for accurate tracking and verification.

servers.server_description: The Hydrolix MCP server allows you to interact with a Hydrolix time-series database cluster
servers.server_summary: Hydrolix time-series datalake integration providing schema exploration and query capabilities to LLM-based workflows.

tools.tool_description: Execute a SELECT query in a Hydrolix time-series database using Clickhouse SQL dialect, ensuring optimal performance with recommended filters or LIMIT clauses to manage query execution time and results.
Retrieve available Hydrolix databases to enable schema exploration and query integration for time-series datalakes in LLM workflows.
Retrieve a list of Hydrolix tables within a specified database to explore and manage schema for time-series data workflows.

servers.server_description: This is a simple Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for IP2Location.io API. It will return a detailed geolocation information for any given IPv4 or IPv6 address.
servers.server_summary: IP Geolocation MCP server using IP2Location.io API to ease the query of geolocation information.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve detailed geolocation data for any IP address, including country, city, latitude, longitude, ASN, ISP, proxy details, and more, using JSON output.

servers.server_description: The Panther MCP Server enables interactive security log analysis and alert management through natural language queries and IDE integrations.
servers.server_summary: Official MCP Server for Panther's security monitoring platform. Write detection rules, investigate alerts, and query security logs using natural language through Claude, Cursor, and other MCP-compatible clients.

tools.tool_description: Add formatted comments to alerts in Panther MCP Server using Markdown. Specify alert ID and comment text to enhance alert context and collaboration during investigations.
Deactivate a specific security detection rule in the Panther MCP Server by setting its enabled status to false, ensuring streamlined rule management and customization.
Run custom SQL queries on Panther's data lake for advanced analysis. Requires p_event_time filter and Snowflake SQL syntax. Use query_id to retrieve results through get_data_lake_query_results.

sql.description: The SQL query to execute. Must include a p_event_time filter condition after WHERE or AND. The query must be compatible with Snowflake SQL.
sql.title: Sql

tools.tool_description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific security alert using its unique ID within the Panther MCP Server for streamlined investigation and monitoring.
Retrieve recent events associated with a specific alert ID using the Panther MCP Server. Limits results to a maximum of 10 events per query to ensure efficient data retrieval.
Analyze data ingestion patterns by retrieving total bytes processed per log type and source, with customizable time intervals and date ranges.

from_date.description: The start date of the metrics period.
from_date.title: From Date

interval_in_minutes.description: How data points are aggregated over time, with smaller intervals providing more granular detail of when events occurred, while larger intervals show broader trends but obscure the precise timing of incidents.
interval_in_minutes.title: Interval In Minutes

to_date.description: The end date of the metrics period.
to_date.title: To Date

tools.tool_description: Retrieve and analyze results from a previously executed data lake query. Provides status, error messages, result rows, column details, query statistics, and pagination details to manage large datasets.

query_id.description: The ID of the query to get results for
query_id.title: Query Id

tools.tool_description: Retrieve Python code and details of a global helper by its ID using Panther MCP Server. Input the helperâ€™s ID to fetch its description and code for security monitoring tasks.

servers.server_description: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open protocol designed to allow AI agents, IDEs, and automation tools to consume, query, and analyze structured data through context-aware APIs.This server wraps Blockscout APIs and exposes blockchain dataâ€”balances, tokens, NFTs, contract metadataâ€”via MCP so that AI agents and tools (like Claude, Cursor, or IDEs) can access and analyze it contextually.
servers.server_summary: A server that exposes blockchain data (balances, tokens, NFTs, contract metadata) via the Model Context Protocol, enabling AI agents and tools to access and analyze blockchain information contextually.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve the latest indexed block number and timestamp to identify the most recent state of the blockchain, ensuring accurate reference for transactions and API calls.
Convert ENS domain names (e.g., 'blockscout.eth') to their corresponding Ethereum addresses using this tool on the Blockscout MCP Server, enabling seamless blockchain data access and analysis.
Retrieve transactions for a specific address within defined time ranges using Blockscout MCP Server. Filter by method signature to access detailed blockchain activity data for analysis.

address.description: Address which either sender or receiver of the transaction
address.title: Address

methods.description: A method signature to filter transactions by (e.g 0x304e6ade)
methods.title: Methods

tools.tool_description: Track ERC-20 token transfers for a specific address within defined time ranges. Filter by token contract and paginate results using start and end timestamps for efficient data retrieval.

address.description: Address which either transfer initiator or transfer receiver
address.title: Address

age_from.description: Start date and time (e.g 2025-05-22T23:00:00.00Z). This parameter should be provided in most cases to limit transfers and avoid heavy database queries. Omit only if you absolutely need the full history.
age_from.title: Age From

age_to.description: End date and time (e.g 2025-05-22T22:30:00.00Z). Can be omitted to get all transfers up to the current time.
age_to.title: Age To

token.description: An ERC-20 token contract address to filter transfers by a specific token. If omitted, returns transfers of all tokens.
token.title: Token

tools.tool_description: Search for token addresses by symbol or name across blockchains using a chain ID. Identify multiple potential matches based on symbol or token name similarity.

symbol.description: Token symbol or name to search for
symbol.title: Symbol

tools.tool_description: Retrieve the ABI (Application Binary Interface) of a smart contract using its chain ID and address. The ABI enables interpretation of contract data and formatting of function calls for blockchain interactions.

address.description: Smart contract address
address.title: Address

servers.server_description: The Token Metrics Model Context Protocol (MCP) server provides comprehensive cryptocurrency data, analytics, and insights through function calling. This server enables AI assistants and agents to access Token Metrics' powerful API for real-time crypto market data, trading signals, price predictions, and advanced analytics.
servers.server_summary: The Token Metrics Model Context Protocol (MCP) server provides comprehensive cryptocurrency data, analytics, and insights through function calling. This server enables AI assistants and agents to access Token Metrics' powerful API for real-time crypto market data, trading signals, price predictions, and advanced analytics.

tools.tool_description: Fetch detailed cryptocurrency token data using ID, symbol, category, exchange, or blockchain address. Retrieve real-time insights like market data, trading signals, and price predictions for informed decision-making.

blockchain_address.description: Use this parameter to search tokens through specific blockchains and contract addresses. Input the blockchain name followed by a colon and then the contract address. Example: binance-smart-chain:0x57185189118c7e786cafd5c71f35b16012fa95ad

category.description: Comma Separated category name. Example: yield farming,defi

exchange.description: Comma Separated exchange name. Example: binance,gate

limit.description: Limit the number of results returned. Default is 50. Maximum is 100.

page.description: Enables pagination and data retrieval control by skipping a specified number of items before fetching data. Page should be a non-negative integer, with 1 indicating the beginning of the dataset.

token_name.description: Comma Separated Crypto Asset Names (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum)

tools.tool_description: Retrieve real-time cryptocurrency prices using token IDs. Input a comma-separated list of token IDs to fetch accurate pricing data via the Token Metrics API. Ideal for accessing up-to-date market information efficiently.

Retrieve hourly OHLCV (Open, High, Low, Close, Volume) data for specific tokens by specifying token IDs, names, symbols, or date ranges using the Token Metrics API for comprehensive cryptocurrency market analysis.

endDate.description: End Date accepts date as a string - YYYY-MM-DD format. Example: 2023-10-10

limit.description: Limit the number of results returned. Default is 50. Maximum is 100.

page.description: Enables pagination and data retrieval control by skipping a specified number of items before fetching data. Page should be a non-negative integer, with 1 indicating the beginning of the dataset.

startDate.description: Start Date accepts date as a string - YYYY-MM-DD format. Example: 2023-10-01

token_name.description: Comma Separated Crypto Asset Names (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum)

tools.tool_description: Fetch daily OHLCV data (Open, High, Low, Close, Volume) for tokens by specifying IDs, names, symbols, or a date range using Token Metrics API. Supports pagination and limits results for precise data retrieval.

endDate.description: End Date accepts date as a string - YYYY-MM-DD format. Example: 2023-10-10

limit.description: Limit the number of results returned. Default is 50. Maximum is 100.

page.description: Enables pagination and data retrieval control by skipping a specified number of items before fetching data. Page should be a non-negative integer, with 1 indicating the beginning of the dataset.

startDate.description: Start Date accepts date as a string - YYYY-MM-DD format. Example: 2023-10-01

token_name.description: Comma Separated Crypto Asset Names (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum)

tools.tool_description: Retrieve long-term token grades, including Technology and Fundamental metrics, for specific dates or ranges using Token Metrics API. Filter by ID, symbol, category, exchange, market cap, and investor grade to analyze crypto investments.

category.description: Comma Separated category name. Example: yield farming,defi

endDate.description: End Date accepts date as a string - YYYY-MM-DD format. Example: 2023-10-10

exchange.description: Comma Separated exchange name. Example: binance,gate

fdv.description: Minimum fully diluted valuation in $ (USD) of the token. Example: 100

investorGrade.description: Minimum TM Investor Grade of the token. Example: 17

limit.description: Limit the number of results returned. Default is 50. Maximum is 100.

marketcap.description: Minimum MarketCap in $ (USD) of the token. Example: 100

page.description: Enables pagination and data retrieval control by skipping a specified number of items before fetching data. Page should be a non-negative integer, with 1 indicating the beginning of the dataset.

startDate.description: Start Date accepts date as a string - YYYY-MM-DD format. Example: 2023-10-01

volume.description: Minimum 24h trading volume in $ (USD) of the token. Example: 100

tools.tool_description: Retrieve crypto market analytics like Bullish/Bearish indicators for specific dates or ranges using Token Metrics API. Enable pagination, limit results, and fetch insights into market trends for informed decision-making.

endDate.description: End Date accepts date as a string - YYYY-MM-DD format. Example: 2023-10-10

page.description: Enables pagination and data retrieval control by skipping a specified number of items before fetching data. Page should be a non-negative integer, with 1 indicating the beginning of the dataset.

startDate.description: Start Date accepts date as a string - YYYY-MM-DD format. Example: 2023-10-01

tools.tool_description: Generate AI-driven trading signals for cryptocurrencies, identifying long and short positions based on token IDs, symbols, dates, market conditions, and technical indicators. Access actionable insights for informed crypto trading decisions.

category.description: Comma Separated category name. Example: yield farming,defi

endDate.description: End Date accepts date as a string - YYYY-MM-DD format. Example: 2023-10-10

exchange.description: Comma Separated exchange name. Example: binance,gate

fdv.description: Minimum fully diluted valuation in $ (USD) of the token. Example: 100

limit.description: Limit the number of results returned. Default is 50. Maximum is 100.

marketcap.description: Minimum MarketCap in $ (USD) of the token. Example: 100

page.description: Enables pagination and data retrieval control by skipping a specified number of items before fetching data. Page should be a non-negative integer, with 1 indicating the beginning of the dataset.

signal.description: The current signal value of the strategy of the token, between bullish (1), bearish (-1) or no signal (0). Example: 1

startDate.description: Start Date accepts date as a string - YYYY-MM-DD format. Example: 2023-10-01

volume.description: Minimum 24h trading volume in $ (USD) of the token. Example: 100

servers.server_description: This project is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) compatible server for interacting with the NEAR blockchain. This tool provides a way for LLMs and AI agents to securely access and interact with NEAR accounts and blockchain functionality.
servers.server_summary: Interact with the NEAR blockchain through MCP calls

tools.tool_description: Call a contract function directly as a raw transaction, specifying arguments, gas, and attached deposit in NEAR blockchain through NEAR MCP server.

accountId.description: The account id of the signer.

args.description: The arguments to pass to the method.

attachedDeposit.description: The amount to attach to the function call (default to 1 yoctoNEAR). Can be specified as a number (in NEAR) or as a bigint (in yoctoNEAR).

contractAccountId.description: The account id of the contract.

gas.description: The amount of gas to use for the function call in yoctoNEAR (default to 30TGas).

methodName.description: The name of the method to call.

tools.tool_description: Cryptographically verify signed data against a NEAR account's public key using specified signature arguments, such as curve and encoding, to ensure data authenticity.

accountId.description: The account id to verify the signature against and search for a valid public key.

curve.description: The curve used on the signature.

encoding.description: The encoding used on the signature.

signatureData.description: The signature data to verify. Only the encoded signature data is required.

tools.tool_description: Parse a NEAR contract's ABI or use nearblocks.io API to retrieve likely function call arguments by analyzing recent execution results.
Query and retrieve available functions from a NEAR smart contract using contract ID and network selection on the NEAR MCP server.
Retrieve and list all accounts with their corresponding keypairs stored in the local keystore for NEAR network, specifying testnet or mainnet.
Retrieve concise account summary data for any NEAR blockchain account using the public RPC endpoint. Input the account ID and network to access essential details.
Search for popular fungible token contracts on the NEAR blockchain using a grep-like pattern. Retrieve detailed contract information for tokens like USDC, USDT, and WNEAR efficiently.

searchPattern.description: The grep search pattern to use for filtering popular fungible token contract information.

tools.tool_description: Export a NEAR account from the local keystore to a file by specifying the account ID and optional file path. Supports mainnet and testnet networks for secure account management.

filePath.description: The path to the file to write the account to. If not provided, the account will be written to the current working directory.

servers.server_description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server providing access to Tatum's blockchain API across 130+ networks with tools including RPC Gateway and Blockchain Data insights.
servers.server_summary: Provides access to Tatum's blockchain API across 40+ networks, enabling developers to interact with blockchain data, manage notifications, estimate fees, access RPC nodes, and work with smart contracts through natural language.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve detailed data for NFTs and multitokens across multiple blockchain networks. Specify the chain and collection addresses to access token information, including names, descriptions, and images. Exclude metadata or filter by token type for customized results.

collectionAddresses.description:
The blockchain addresses of the collections.
It is possible to enter list of up to 10 addresses as a comma separated string.

excludeMetadata.description: The option to exclude metadata from the response.

offset.description: The offset to obtain next page of the data.

pageSize.description: The number of items per page (default is 50).

tokenTypes.description:
The option to select only specific token types.
It is possible to enter list of multiple types as a comma separated string.
Use nft (includes ERC-721 and ERC-1155) or multitoken (ERC-1155 only).

tools.tool_description: Retrieve metadata for NFTs or multitokens by specifying chain, token address, and IDs. Works across Ethereum, Base, Arbitrum, BNB Smart Chain, Polygon, Optimism, Celo, and Chiliz blockchains.

tokenAddress.description: The blockchain address of the NFT to get metadata for.

tokenIds.description:
The IDs of the tokens to get metadata for.
It is possible to enter list of multiple IDs as a comma separated string.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve native wallet balances for up to 10 addresses at a specific block number, time, or Unix timestamp on supported blockchains using Tatum MCP Serverâ€™s API.

addresses.description:
The blockchain public wallet addresses.
It is possible to enter list of up to 10 addresses as a comma separated string.

unix.description: Unix timestamp when block is processed.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve wallet balances for native tokens, ERC-20, ERC-721, and ERC-1155 assets across Ethereum, BSC, Polygon, Celo, Chiliz, and Tezos blockchains. Specify addresses and token types to filter results and exclude metadata if needed.

addresses.description:
The blockchain public wallet addresses.
It is possible to enter list of up to 10 addresses as a comma separated string.

excludeMetadata.description: The option to exclude metadata from the response.

offset.description: The offset to obtain next page of the data.

pageSize.description: The number of items per page (default is 50).

tokenTypes.description:
The option to select only specific token types.
It is possible to enter list of multiple types as a comma separated string.
Use native, fungible (ERC-20), nft (includes ERC-721 and ERC-1155) or multitoken (ERC-1155 only).

tools.tool_description: Retrieve detailed blockchain wallet portfolio balances, including native, fungible tokens, and NFTs, across multiple chains using Tatum MCP Server. Specify token types and exclude metadata for tailored results.

addresses.description:
The blockchain public wallet addresses.
Only one address is allowed.

excludeMetadata.description: The option to exclude metadata from the response.

offset.description: The offset to obtain next page of the data.

pageSize.description: The number of items per page (default is 50).

tokenTypes.description:
The option to select only specific token types.
Use [native], [fungible] (ERC-20), [nft,multitoken] (includes ERC-721 and ERC-1155)

tools.tool_description: Retrieve token balances (fungible, NFTs, multitokens) for specified wallet addresses across multiple blockchains. Use chain name and addresses to fetch detailed token information and metadata.

addresses.description:
The blockchain public wallet addresses.
It is possible to enter list of up to 10 addresses as a comma separated string.

excludeMetadata.description: The option to exclude metadata from the response.

offset.description: The offset to obtain next page of the data.

pageSize.description: The number of items per page (default is 50).

tokenTypes.description:
The option to select only specific token types.
It is possible to enter list of multiple types as a comma separated string.
Use fungible (ERC-20), nft (includes ERC-721 and ERC-1155) or multitoken (ERC-1155 only).

tools.tool_description: Retrieve addresses of all token owners across multiple blockchains (ERC-20, ERC-721, ERC-1155) using chain name and token address, or specify tokenId for a specific NFT owner.

offset.description: The offset to obtain next page of the data.

pageSize.description: The number of items per page (default is 50).

tokenAddress.description: The blockchain address of the token (NFT collection or any fungible token).

tokenId.description: The ID of a specific NFT token.

tools.tool_description: Verify wallet ownership of specific tokens (ERC-20, ERC-721, ERC-1155) across multiple blockchains. Provide chain name, wallet address, and token address to check ownership instantly.

address.description: The blockchain address of the wallet.

tools.tool_description: Execute TypeScript code in Google Cloud Platform environments using official client libraries. Automates GCP queries and management tasks, handles errors, ensures pagination, and returns concise JSON outputs for efficient processing.

code.description:
Your job is to answer questions about GCP environment by writing Javascript/TypeScript code using Google Cloud Client Libraries. The code must adhere to a few rules:
- Must use promises and async/await
- Think step-by-step before writing the code, approach it logically
- Must be written in TypeScript using official Google Cloud client libraries
- Avoid hardcoded values like project IDs
- Code written should be as parallel as possible enabling the fastest and most optimal execution
- Code should handle errors gracefully, especially when doing multiple API calls
- Each error should be handled and logged with a reason, script should continue to run despite errors
- Data returned from GCP APIs must be returned as JSON containing only the minimal amount of data needed to answer the question
- All extra data must be filtered out
- Code MUST "return" a value: string, number, boolean or JSON object
- If code does not return anything, it will be considered as FAILED
- Whenever tool/function call fails, retry it 3 times before giving up
- When listing resources, ensure pagination is handled correctly
- Do not include any comments in the code
- Try to write code that returns as few data as possible to answer without any additional processing required
Be concise, professional and to the point. Do not give generic advice, always reply with detailed & contextual data sourced from the current GCP environment.

projectId.description: GCP project ID to use

region.description: Region to use (if not provided, us-central1 is used)

tools.tool_description: Retrieve and filter SonarCloud issues for a specific pull request, enabling focused code quality analysis and resolution. Supports custom sorting, component-based filtering, and detailed issue facets.

additionalFields.description: Comma-separated list of the optional fields to be returned in response. Action plans are dropped in 5.5, it is not returned in the response.

assigned.description: To retrieve assigned or unassigned issues

assignees.description: Comma-separated list of assignee logins. The value '__me__' can be used as a placeholder for user who performs the request

author.description: SCM accounts. To set several values, the parameter must be called once for each value.

cleanCodeAttributeCategories.description: Comma-separated list of clean code attribute categories.

componentKeys.description: Comma-separated list of component keys. Retrieve issues associated to a specific list of components (and all its descendants). A component can be a project, directory or file.

createdAfter.description: To retrieve issues created after the given date (inclusive). Either a date (server timezone) or datetime can be provided. If this parameter is set, createdSince must not be set

createdAt.description: Datetime to retrieve issues created during a specific analysis

createdBefore.description: To retrieve issues created before the given date (inclusive). Either a date (server timezone) or datetime can be provided.

createdInLast.description: To retrieve issues created during a time span before the current time (exclusive). Accepted units are 'y' for year, 'm' for month, 'w' for week and 'd' for day. If this parameter is set, createdAfter must not be set

cwe.description: Comma-separated list of CWE identifiers. Use 'unknown' to select issues not associated to any CWE.

facets.description: Comma-separated list of the facets to be computed. No facet is computed by default.

languages.description: Comma-separated list of languages. Available since 4.4

onComponentOnly.description: Return only issues at a component's level, not on its descendants (modules, directories, files, etc). This parameter is only considered when componentKeys or componentUuids is set. (default: false)

owaspTop10.description: Comma-separated list of OWASP Top 10 lowercase categories.

owaspTop10-2021.description: Comma-separated list of OWASP Top 10 - 2021 lowercase categories.

ps.description: Page size. Must be greater than 0 and less or equal than 500 (default: 100)

resolved.description: To match resolved or unresolved issues

rules.description: Comma-separated list of coding rule keys. Format is <repository>:<rule>

sinceLeakPeriod.description: To retrieve issues created since the leak period. If this parameter is set to a truthy value, createdAfter must not be set and one component id or key must be provided. (default: false)

sonarsourceSecurity.description: Comma-separated list of SonarSource security categories. Use 'others' to select issues not associated with any category

token.description: SonarCloud API token (optional if set in environment)

tools.tool_description: Generate a concise summary of SonarCloud issues for a specific pull request. Filter by severity, status, and leak period to streamline code quality analysis and issue resolution.

sinceLeakPeriod.description: To retrieve issues created since the leak period. If this parameter is set to a truthy value, createdAfter must not be set and one component id or key must be provided. (default: false)

servers.server_description: An MCP server (stdio transport) that wraps Hugging Face's LocalPythonExecutor (from the smolagents framework). This package allows to expose the Python executor via MCP (Model Context Protocol) as a tool for LLM apps like Claude Desktop, Cursor or any other MCP compatible client. In case of Claude Desktop this tool is an easy way to add a missing Code Interpreter (available as a plugin in ChatGPT for quite a while already).
servers.server_summary: Stdio MCP Server wrapping custom Python runtime (LocalPythonExecutor) from Hugging Faces' `smolagents` framework. Gmail search query (e.g., "from:example@gmail.com has:attachment"). Examples:
- "from:alice@example.com" (Emails from Alice)
- "to:bob@example.com" (Emails sent to Bob)
- "subject:Meeting Update" (Emails with "Meeting Update" in the subject)
- "has:attachment filename:pdf" (Emails with PDF attachments)
- "after:2024/01/01 before:2024/02/01" (Emails between specific dates)
- "is:unread" (Unread emails)
- "from:@company.com has:attachment" (Emails from a company domain with attachments)

- mandatory: Whether field is required

tools.tool_description: Schedule LinkedIn posts for a specific date and time, with optional image or video attachments, using direct URLs for media files.

filename.description: A filename for the media item (e.g., 'meeting_notes.mp4').

post_text.description: The text content of the LinkedIn post to be scheduled.

scheduled_date.description: The date and time to publish the post, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2025-12-31T10:00:00Z' or '2025-12-31T15:30:00+05:30'). Must be in the future.

content.description: The source content to transform into LinkedIn posts. Can be articles, emails, newsletters, notes, etc.

content_type.description: Optional. A short description of the content type (e.g., 'article', 'newsletter', 'notes'). Defaults to 'article'.

body.description: Request body for POST/PUT requests. For components, use: { data: { componentName: { field: 'value' } } } for single components or { data: { componentName: [{ field: 'value' }] } } for repeatable components

params.description: Optional query parameters for GET requests. For components, use populate: ['componentName'] or populate: { componentName: { fields: ['field1'] } }

userAuthorized.description: REQUIRED for POST/PUT/DELETE operations. Client MUST obtain explicit user authorization before setting this to true.

content.description:
Post content in WordPress block format. Here is an example of the format: If you given following blocks documentation: ``` Name: core/paragraph Title: Paragraph Description: Start with the basic building block of all narrative. Category: text ##Attributes ###align type: string ###content type: rich-text source: rich-text selector: p role: content ###dropCap type: boolean default: false ###placeholder type: string ###direction type: string enum: ltr,rtl ###lock type: object ###metadata type: object ###className type: string ###style type: object ###backgroundColor type: string ###textColor type: string ###gradient type: string ###fontSize type: string ###fontFamily type: string ###borderColor type: string ``` You can use the following format: ```

Your paragraph content here.

```

Category: text ##Attributes ###align type: string ###content type: rich-text source: rich-text selector: p role: content ###dropCap type: boolean default: false ###placeholder type: string ###direction type: string enum: ltr,rtl ###lock type: object ###metadata type: object ###className type: string ###style type: object ###backgroundColor type: string ###textColor type: string ###gradient type: string ###fontSize type: string ###fontFamily type: string ###borderColor type: string ``` You can use the following format: ```

Your paragraph content here.

```

tools.tool_description: Deploy Kafka connectors by specifying configuration details such as environment, cluster, and connector class. Simplifies integration with Confluent Kafka and Confluent Cloud REST APIs.

baseUrl.description: The base URL of the Kafka Connect REST API.

clusterId.description: The unique identifier for the Kafka cluster.

confluent.connector.type.description: Required for Custom Connector. The connector type

confluent.custom.connection.endpoints.description: Optional for Custom Connector. Egress endpoint(s) for the connector

confluent.custom.plugin.id.description: Required for Custom Connector. The custom plugin id of custom connector

confluent.custom.schema.registry.auto.description: Optional for Custom Connector. Automatically add required schema registry properties

connector.class.description: Required for Managed Connector, Ignored for Custom Connector. The connector class name, e.g., BigQuerySink, GcsSink, etc.

connectorName.description: The name of the connector to create.

environmentId.description: The unique identifier for the environment this resource belongs to.
