servers.server_description: Enables AI integrations with ClickUp tasks, supporting resource management, task operations, workspace organization, and AI-powered task recommendations through a standardized protocol.
servers.server_summary: Enables AI integrations with ClickUp tasks, supporting resource management, task operations, workspace organization, and AI-powered task recommendations through a standardized protocol.

tools.tool_description: Permanently remove a task from your ClickUp workspace using the task ID for secure deletion. Ensure accuracy by referencing the task ID from prior responses to avoid redundant searches.

listName.description: Optional: Name of the list to narrow down task search when multiple tasks have the same name

taskId.description: ID of the task to delete - this is required for safety to prevent accidental deletions. If you have this ID from a previous response, use it directly.

taskName.description: Name of the task to delete - will automatically find the task by name (optional if using taskId instead). Only use this if you don't already have the task ID from previous responses.

tools.tool_description: Relocate a task within your ClickUp workspace by moving it from its current list to a specified destination list using task and list IDs or names. Task statuses may reset if destination list uses different status options.

listId.description: ID of the destination list (optional if using listName instead). If you have this ID from a previous response, use it directly rather than looking up by name.

listName.description: Name of the destination list - will automatically find the list by name (optional if using listId instead). Only use this if you don't already have the list ID from previous responses.

sourceListName.description: Optional: Name of the source list to narrow down task search when multiple tasks have the same name

taskId.description: ID of the task to move (optional if using taskName instead). If you have this ID from a previous response, use it directly rather than looking up by name.

taskName.description: Name of the task to move - will automatically find the task by name (optional if using taskId instead). Only use this if you don't already have the task ID from previous responses.

tools.tool_description: Generate a new list within an existing ClickUp folder by specifying the folder ID or name. Streamline task organization by directly creating lists in defined folder structures, avoiding redundant lookups with pre-provided IDs.

content.description: Description or content of the list

folderId.description: ID of the folder to create the list in (optional if using folderName instead). If you have this ID from a previous response, use it directly rather than looking up by name.

folderName.description: Name of the folder to create the list in - will automatically find the folder by name (optional if using folderId instead). Only use this if you don't already have the folder ID from previous responses.

spaceId.description: ID of the space containing the folder (optional if using spaceName instead). If you have this ID from a previous response, use it directly rather than looking up by name.

spaceName.description: Name of the space containing the folder - will automatically find the space by name (optional if using spaceId instead). Only use this if you don't already have the space ID from previous responses.

status.description: Status of the list (uses folder default if not specified)

tools.tool_description: Permanently delete a list and its tasks from your ClickUp workspace. Requires the list ID or name to confirm removal. Use with caution, as this action is irreversible.

listId.description: ID of the list to delete (optional if using listName instead). If you have this ID from a previous response, use it directly rather than looking up by name.

listName.description: Name of the list to delete - will automatically find the list by name (optional if using listId instead). Only use this if you don't already have the list ID from previous responses.

tools.tool_description: Permanently remove a folder and its contents from your ClickUp workspace. Ensure you have the folder ID or name and corresponding space details to execute the deletion, as this action cannot be undone.

folderId.description: ID of the folder to delete (optional if using folderName instead). If you have this ID from a previous response, use it directly rather than looking up by name.

folderName.description: Name of the folder to delete - will automatically find the folder by name (optional if using folderId instead). Only use this if you don't already have the folder ID from previous responses.

spaceId.description: ID of the space containing the folder (optional if using spaceName instead, and only needed when using folderName). If you have this ID from a previous response, use it directly rather than looking up by name.

spaceName.description: Name of the space containing the folder (optional if using spaceId instead, and only needed when using folderName). Only use this if you don't already have the space ID from previous responses.

tools.tool_description: Modify properties of an existing task in ClickUp, such as name, description, status, priority, or due date. Only specified fields are updated, keeping other fields unchanged. Use task ID from prior responses to avoid redundant lookups.

description.description: New plain text description for the task

listName.description: Optional: Name of the list to narrow down task search when multiple tasks have the same name

markdown_description.description: New markdown formatted description for the task. If provided, this takes precedence over description

priority.description: New priority for the task (1-4 or null), where 1 is urgent/highest priority and 4 is lowest priority. Set to null to clear priority.

status.description: New status for the task (must be a valid status in the task's list)

taskId.description: ID of the task to update (optional if using taskName instead). If you have this ID from a previous response, use it directly rather than looking up by name.

taskName.description: Name of the task to update - will automatically find the task by name (optional if using taskId instead). Only use this if you don't already have the task ID from previous responses.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve the complete ClickUp workspace hierarchy, including spaces, folders, and lists with IDs, names, and paths. Use this tool when workspace structure details are required and not already available in recent context.
Organize lists in ClickUp by creating a new folder within a specified space. Simplify task management by grouping related lists together for better structure and efficiency.

override_statuses.description: Whether to override space statuses with folder-specific statuses

spaceId.description: ID of the space to create the folder in (optional if using spaceName instead). If you have this ID from a previous response, use it directly rather than looking up by name.

spaceName.description: Name of the space to create the folder in - will automatically find the space by name (optional if using spaceId instead). Only use this if you don't already have the space ID from previous responses.

tools.tool_description: Query and retrieve content from basic-memory using exact permalinks, path patterns, or full-text search with boolean operators. Filter results by item type, entity type, or date.

SearchQuery.description:
Search query parameters.

Use ONE of these primary search modes:
- permalink: Exact permalink match
- permalink_match: Path pattern with *
- text: Full-text search of title/content (supports boolean operators: AND, OR, NOT)

Optionally filter results by:
- types: Limit to specific item types
- entity_types: Limit to specific entity types
- after_date: Only items after date

Boolean search examples:
- "python AND flask" - Find items with both terms
- "python OR django" - Find items with either term
- "python NOT django" - Find items with python but not django
- "(python OR flask) AND web" - Use parentheses for grouping
SearchQuery.title: SearchQuery

tools.tool_description: Verify if the IDA Pro plugin is active and connected to the MCP server for automated reverse engineering tasks.
Retrieve detailed metadata from the current IDB file to streamline reverse engineering tasks in IDA Pro.
Define or modify local types in IDA Pro using C declarations. Automates type creation for reverse engineering workflows with clear, structured input.

c_declaration.description: C declaration of the type. Examples include: typedef int foo_t; struct bar { int a; bool b; };
c_declaration.title: C Declaration

servers.server_description: The MCP Atlassian server enables integration with Atlassian products (Jira and Confluence) via the Model Context Protocol, allowing AI assistants to manage content and projects efficiently
servers.server_summary: Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Atlassian products (Confluence and Jira). This integration supports both Confluence & Jira Cloud and Server/Data Center deployments.

tools.tool_description: Attach files or content to a Confluence page using the specified page ID and attachment name, enabling organized documentation within MCP Atlassian integrations.

page_id.description: The ID of the page to attach the content to

tools.tool_description: Retrieve all issues for a specific Jira project using the MCP Atlantisantool. Specify the project key and limit results to streamline issue management and tracking.

limit.description: Maximum number of results (1-50)

tools.tool_description: Retrieve available status transitions for a Jira issue by providing the issue key. Supports Jira Cloud, Server, and Data Center integrations via MCP Atlassian.
Download attachments from a Jira issue by specifying the issue key and target directory for storage using the MCP Atlassian server integration.

target_dir.description: Directory where attachments should be saved

tools.tool_description: Add a Markdown-formatted comment to a specified Jira issue using the MCP Atlassian server. Simplify issue tracking and team collaboration with automated comments.
Link an existing Jira issue to an epic using issue and epic keys. Simplifies task organization within Jira projects for better workflow clarity.

epic_key.description: The key of the epic to link to (e.g., 'PROJ-456')

issue_key.description: The key of the issue to link (e.g., 'PROJ-123')

tools.tool_description: Retrieve child pages of a specific Confluence page with options to expand fields, include content, and set a limit. Integrates with MCP Atlassian for Confluence and Jira Cloud or Server/Data Center.

expand.description: Fields to expand in the response (e.g., 'version', 'body.storage')

include_content.description: Whether to include the page content in the response

limit.description: Maximum number of child pages to return (1-50)

parent_id.description: The ID of the parent page whose children you want to retrieve

servers.server_description: MCP server for generating images using Amazon Nova Canvas
servers.server_summary: Provides image generation capabilities using Amazon Nova Canvas through Amazon Bedrock, enabling the creation of visuals from text prompts and color palettesâ€”perfect for mockups, diagrams, and UI design concepts.

tools.tool_description: Create images from text prompts using AWS Nova Canvas. Save generated visuals to your workspace, ensuring precise customization with prompt details, dimensions, and quality settings.

cfg_scale.description: How strongly the image adheres to the prompt (1.1-10.0)
cfg_scale.title: Cfg Scale

filename.description: The name of the file to save the image to (without extension)
filename.title: Filename

height.description: The height of the generated image (320-4096, divisible by 16)
height.title: Height

negative_prompt.description: Text to define what not to include in the image (1-1024 characters)
negative_prompt.title: Negative Prompt

number_of_images.description: The number of images to generate (1-5)
number_of_images.title: Number Of Images

prompt.description: The text description of the image to generate (1-1024 characters)
prompt.title: Prompt

quality.description: The quality of the generated image ("standard" or "premium")
quality.title: Quality

width.description: The width of the generated image (320-4096, divisible by 16)
width.title: Width

workspace_dir.description:
The current workspace directory where the image should be saved.
        CRITICAL: Assistant must always provide the current IDE workspace directory parameter to save images to the user's current project.
workspace_dir.title: Workspace Dir

colors.description: List of up to 10 hexadecimal color values (e.g., "#FF9800")

quality.description: The quality of the generated image ("standard" or "premium")
quality.title: Quality

width.description: The width of the generated image (320-4096, divisible by 16)

workspace_dir.description: The current workspace directory where the image should be saved. CRITICAL: Assistant must always provide this parameter to save images to the user's current project.

servers.server_description: A fully featured coding agent that uses symbolic operations (enabled by language servers) and works well even in large code bases. Essentially a free to use alternative to Cursor and Windsurf Agents, Cline, Roo Code and others.
servers.server_summary: A fully featured coding agent that uses symbolic operations (enabled by language servers) and works well even in large code bases. Essentially a free to use alternative to Cursor and Windsurf Agents, Cline, Roo Code and others.

tools.tool_description: Restart Serena's language server to resolve editing errors caused by outdated state. Use when edits outside Serena lead to unresponsive or incorrect behavior in the coding interface.

Retrieve the full text or specific lines from a file on the MCP server Serena by specifying the relative path, start line, and end line. Use this tool when granular file access is needed for task execution.

end_line.description: The 0-based index of the last line to be retrieved (inclusive). If None, read until the end of the file.
end_line.title: End Line

max_answer_chars.description:
If the file (chunk) is longer than this number of characters,
no content will be returned. Don't adjust unless there is really no other way to get the content
required for the task.
max_answer_chars.title: Max Answer Chars

relative_path.description: The relative path to the file to read.
relative_path.title: Relative Path

start_line.description: The 0-based index of the first line to be retrieved.
start_line.title: Start Line

tools.tool_description: Generate or overwrite text files with specified content using symbolic operations for precision. Ideal for managing file creation and editing in large code bases.

content.description: The (utf-8-encoded) content to write to the file.
content.title: Content

relative_path.description: The relative path to the file to create.
relative_path.title: Relative Path

tools.tool_description: Retrieve files and directories within a specified path using JSON output, with options for recursive scanning and output length control on Serena's MCP server.

max_answer_chars.description:
If the output is longer than this number of characters,
no content will be returned. Don't adjust unless there is really no other way to get the content
required for the task.
max_answer_chars.title: Max Answer Chars

relative_path.description: The relative path to the directory to list; pass "." to scan the project root.
relative_path.title: Relative Path

tools.tool_description: Search for files matching a specific file mask within a given relative path. Returns a JSON object listing all matching files for streamlined file management.

file_mask.description: The filename or file mask (using the wildcards * or ?) to search for.
file_mask.title: File Mask

relative_path.description: The relative path to the directory to search in; pass "." to scan the project root.
relative_path.title: Relative Path

tools.tool_description: Retrieve a high-level overview of top-level symbols in a file or directory using JSON output. Optimize code understanding before reading, searching, or editing operations.

max_answer_chars.description:
If the overview is longer than this number of characters,
no content will be returned. Don't adjust unless there is really no other way to get the content
required for the task. If the overview is too long, you should use a smaller directory instead,
(e.g. a subdirectory).
max_answer_chars.title: Max Answer Chars

relative_path.description: The relative path to the file or directory to get the overview of.
relative_path.title: Relative Path

tools.tool_description: Modify the body of a specified symbol in code files automatically. Ensures correct indentation by aligning with the original symbol's structure, simplifying updates in large codebases.

name_path.description: For finding the symbol to replace, same logic as in the `find_symbol` tool.
name_path.title: Name Path

relative_path.description: The relative path to the file containing the symbol.
relative_path.title: Relative Path

servers.server_description: This server enables interaction with Supabase PostgreSQL databases through the MCP protocol, allowing seamless integration with Cursor and Windsurf IDEs for secure and validated database management.
servers.server_summary: This server enables interaction with Supabase PostgreSQL databases through the MCP protocol, allowing seamless integration with Cursor and Windsurf IDEs for secure and validated database management.

tools.tool_description: Send requests to the Supabase Management API to programmatically manage project settings, resources, and configurations. Specify HTTP method, path, parameters, and body for customized API calls, with automatic injection of project reference and safety mode controls for secure operations.

Retrieve the complete OpenAPI specification for the Supabase Management API. Access endpoints, parameters, schemas, and safety details for API operations across domains like Auth, Database, Storage, and more. Use optional filters to focus on specific paths, methods, or domains.

Execute a confirmed high-risk database or API operation securely by using its confirmation ID. Designed for Supabase MCP Server, this tool ensures precise execution without retyping queries or parameters. Confirmations expire after 5 minutes for enhanced security.

Retrieve detailed schema information for a specific table, including columns, keys, relationships, indexes, constraints, and triggers. This low-risk read operation supports secure database management and integration with Supabase PostgreSQL databases.
Retrieve detailed information on all database schemas, including sizes and table counts, for efficient Supabase PostgreSQL database management.

Enable or disable unsafe mode for Management API or Database operations in Supabase MCP Server. Use to allow higher-risk actions like INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, and schema changes, then return to safe mode for read operations.

Run PostgreSQL queries on Supabase databases, handling READ, WRITE, and SCHEMA operations with safety controls. Requires UNSAFE mode for modifications and confirms high-risk actions to ensure secure database management.

servers.server_description: Vizro-MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server, which works alongside a LLM to help you create Vizro dashboards and charts.
servers.server_summary: The Vizro MCP server assists in creating, validating, and visualizing Vizro dashboards and charts using an LLM.

tools.tool_description: Validate Vizro dashboard configurations for accuracy and completeness. Returns Python code, PyCafe links for remote files, and automatically opens them if enabled. Ensures proper integration of data files and model settings.

Verify chart code accuracy and PyCafe link functionality. Input chart configuration and dataset metadata to ensure compliance with Python and Plotly standards, optionally opening the PyCafe link in a browser.

ChartPlan.description: Base chart plan used to generate chart code based on user visualization requirements.

chart_code.description:
Python code that generates a generates a plotly go.Figure object. It must fulfill the following criteria:
        1. Must be wrapped in a function name
        2. Must accept a single argument `data_frame` which is a pandas DataFrame
        3. Must return a plotly go.Figure object
        4. All data used in the chart must be derived from the data_frame argument, all data manipulations
        must be done within the function.
chart_code.title: Chart Code

chart_type.description: Describes the chart type that best reflects the user request.
chart_type.title: Chart Type

imports.description:
List of import statements required to render the chart defined by the `chart_code` field. Ensure that every
        import statement is a separate list/array entry: An example of valid list of import statements would be:

        ["import pandas as pd",
        "import plotly.express as px"]
imports.title: Imports

ChartPlan.title: ChartPlan

tools.tool_description: Retrieve sample dataset details for analysis or visualization. Specify dataset name (iris, tips, stocks, gapminder) to obtain relevant information for creating charts, graphs, or exploratory tasks.
Retrieve the JSON schema for a specific Vizro model by providing the model name. Use this tool to understand the structure and requirements of models like 'Card', 'Dashboard', or 'Page'.
Generate step-by-step instructions for creating a Vizro chart or dashboard. Provides initial guidance when tasked with building Vizro visualizations.
Load and analyze data from CSV, JSON, Excel, and other formats into a pandas DataFrame with detailed insights and metadata. Simplify data exploration for structured analysis.

servers.server_description: Unleashes LLM-powered agents to autonomously execute and debug web apps directly in your code editor, with features like webapp navigation, network traffic capture, and console error collection.
servers.server_summary: Unleashes LLM-powered agents to autonomously execute and debug web apps directly in your code editor, with features like webapp navigation, network traffic capture, and console error collection.

tools.tool_description: Assess and improve web application user experience by analyzing specific tasks, identifying UI/UX issues, and providing actionable recommendations for enhancement.

servers.server_summary: A Model Context Protocol server that enables agent applications like Cursor and Cline to integrate with Alibaba Cloud Function Compute, allowing them to deploy and manage serverless functions through natural language interactions.

tools.tool_description: Deploy a custom runtime project to Alibaba Cloud Function Compute without manual packaging. Automatically handles code deployment and updates existing functions. Specify region, function name, and runtime configuration for seamless integration.

servers.server_description: This project provides a dedicated MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that wraps the @google/genai SDK. It exposes Google's Gemini model capabilities as standard MCP tools, allowing other LLMs (like Cline) or MCP-compatible systems to leverage Gemini's features as a backend workhorse.
servers.server_summary: A dedicated server that wraps Google's Gemini AI models in a Model Context Protocol (MCP) interface, allowing other LLMs and MCP-compatible systems to access Gemini's capabilities like content generation, function calling, chat, and file handling through standardized tools.

tools.tool_description: Upload files to the Gemini API by specifying a local path, returning metadata with unique name and URI. Requires Google AI Studio API keys; supports optional display name and MIME type.

displayName.description: Optional. A human-readable name for the file in the API. Max 100 chars.

filePath.description: Required. The full local path to the file that needs to be uploaded.

mimeType.description: Optional. The IANA MIME type of the file (e.g., 'text/plain', 'image/jpeg'). If omitted, the server will attempt to infer it from the file extension of filePath.

tools.tool_description: Streams text content in real-time using Google's Gemini model, ideal for interactive applications or managing lengthy responses. Accepts a text prompt and offers optional parameters to customize generation and safety settings.

generationConfig.description: Optional configuration for controlling the generation process.

maxOutputTokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate in the response.

stopSequences.description: Sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

temperature.description: Controls randomness. Lower values (~0.2) make output more deterministic, higher values (~0.8) make it more creative. Default varies by model.

topK.description: Top-k sampling parameter. The model considers the k most probable tokens. Default varies by model.

topP.description: Nucleus sampling parameter. The model considers only tokens with probability mass summing to this value. Default varies by model.

modelName.description: Optional. The name of the Gemini model to use (e.g., 'gemini-1.5-flash'). If omitted, the server's default model (from GOOGLE_GEMINI_MODEL env var) will be used.

prompt.description: Required. The text prompt to send to the Gemini model for content generation.

safetySettings.description: Optional. A list of safety settings to apply, overriding default model safety settings.

items.description: Setting for controlling content safety for a specific harm category.

category.description: Category of harmful content to apply safety settings for.

threshold.description: Threshold for blocking harmful content. Higher thresholds block more content.

tools.tool_description: Generate personalized greeting messages by inputting a name and selecting a language. The tool on MCP Gemini Server uses structured input parameters to deliver tailored outputs for various use cases.

language.description: Optional language code for the greeting (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr'). Defaults to 'en' if not provided or invalid.

name.description: The name to include in the greeting message. Required, 1-50 characters.

tools.tool_description: Transmits the results of executed functions to an ongoing Gemini chat session using its sessionId, enabling the model to generate a response based on the provided function outcomes.

functionResponses.description: Required. An array containing the results of the function calls executed by the client. Each item must include the function 'name' and its 'response' object.

items.description: Represents the result of a single function execution to be sent back to the model.

name.description: Required. The name of the function that was called by the model.

response.description: Required. The JSON object result returned by the function execution.

generationConfig.description: Optional. Per-request generation configuration settings to override session defaults for this turn.

maxOutputTokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate in the response.

stopSequences.description: Sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

temperature.description: Controls randomness. Lower values (~0.2) make output more deterministic, higher values (~0.8) make it more creative. Default varies by model.

topK.description: Top-k sampling parameter. The model considers the k most probable tokens. Default varies by model.

topP.description: Nucleus sampling parameter. The model considers only tokens with probability mass summing to this value. Default varies by model.

safetySettings.description: Optional. Per-request safety settings to override session defaults for this turn.

items.description: Setting for controlling content safety for a specific harm category.

category.description: Category of harmful content to apply safety settings for.

threshold.description: Threshold for blocking harmful content. Higher thresholds block more content.

sessionId.description: Required. The unique identifier of the chat session.

tools.tool_description: Facilitates function calling with Google Gemini models by accepting function declarations and returning text responses or function call requests based on the prompt. Does not execute functions directly.

functionDeclarations.description: Required. An array of function declarations (schemas) that the model can choose to call based on the prompt.

items.description: Declaration of a single function that the Gemini model can request to call.

description.description: A description of what the function does. Used by the model to decide when to call it.

name.description: The name of the function to be called. Must match the name the model is expected to use.

parameters.description: Schema defining the parameters the function accepts. Must be of type OBJECT.

additionalProperties.description: Schema defining a single parameter for a function declaration, potentially recursive.

enum.description: Allowed string values for an ENUM-like parameter.

items.description: Defines the schema for items if the parameter type is ARRAY.

required.description: List of required property names for OBJECT types.

type.description: The data type of the function parameter.

properties.description: Defines the parameters the function accepts.

required.description: List of required parameter names at the top level.

type.description: The top-level parameters structure must be an OBJECT.

generationConfig.description: Optional configuration for controlling the generation process.

maxOutputTokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate in the response.

stopSequences.description: Sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

temperature.description: Controls randomness. Lower values (~0.2) make output more deterministic, higher values (~0.8) make it more creative. Default varies by model.

topK.description: Top-k sampling parameter. The model considers the k most probable tokens. Default varies by model.

topP.description: Nucleus sampling parameter. The model considers only tokens with probability mass summing to this value. Default varies by model.

modelName.description: Optional. The name of the Gemini model to use (e.g., 'gemini-1.5-flash'). If omitted, the server's default model (from GOOGLE_GEMINI_MODEL env var) will be used.

prompt.description: Required. The text prompt to send to the Gemini model.

items.description: Setting for controlling content safety for a specific harm category.

category.description: Category of harmful content to apply safety settings for.

threshold.description: Threshold for blocking harmful content. Higher thresholds block more content.

toolConfig.description: Optional configuration for tools, specifically function calling.

allowedFunctionNames.description: Optional list of function names allowed to be called. If specified, the model will only call functions from this list.

tools.tool_description: Start a stateful chat session with a Gemini model, returning a unique sessionId for continued interaction. Customize with initial history, generation settings, and safety configurations.

maxOutputTokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate in the response.

stopSequences.description: Sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

temperature.description: Controls randomness. Lower values (~0.2) make output more deterministic, higher values (~0.8) make it more creative. Default varies by model.

topK.description: Top-k sampling parameter. The model considers the k most probable tokens. Default varies by model.

topP.description: Nucleus sampling parameter. The model considers only tokens with probability mass summing to this value. Default varies by model.

items.description: A single message turn in the conversation history.

parts.description: An array of Parts making up the message content.

items.description: Setting for controlling content safety for a specific harm category.

category.description: Category of harmful content to apply safety settings for.

threshold.description: Threshold for blocking harmful content. Higher thresholds block more content.

tools.description: Optional. A list of tools (currently only supporting function declarations) the model may use during the chat session.

functionDeclarations.description: List of function declarations for this tool.

tools.tool_description: Create regional distribution maps to visualize administrative divisions and dataset coverage within China. Configure titles, data types, and styles to display regional data distribution or composition effectively.

data.description: Administrative division data, lower-level administrative divisions are optional. There are usually two scenarios: one is to simply display the regional composition, only `fillColor` needs to be configured, and all administrative divisions are consistent, representing that all blocks are connected as one; the other is the regional data distribution scenario, first determine the `dataType`, `dataValueUnit` and `dataLabel` configurations, `dataValue` should be a meaningful value and consistent with the meaning of dataType, and then determine the style configuration. The `fillColor` configuration represents the default fill color for areas without data. Lower-level administrative divisions do not need `fillColor` configuration, and their fill colors are determined by the `colors` configuration (If `dataType` is "number", only one base color (warm color) is needed in the list to calculate the continuous data mapping color band; if `dataType` is "enum", the number of color values in the list is equal to the number of enumeration values (contrast colors)). If `subdistricts` has a value, `showAllSubdistricts` must be set to true. For example, {"title": "é™•è¥¿çœåœ°çº§å¸‚åˆ†å¸ƒå›¾", "data": {"name": "é™•è¥¿çœ", "showAllSubdistricts": true, "dataLabel": "åŸŽå¸‚", "dataType": "enum", "colors": ["#4ECDC4", "#A5D8FF"], "subdistricts": [{"name": "è¥¿å®‰å¸‚", "dataValue": "çœä¼š"}, {"name": "å®é¸¡å¸‚", "dataValue": "åœ°çº§å¸‚"}, {"name": "å’¸é˜³å¸‚", "dataValue": "åœ°çº§å¸‚"}, {"name": "é“œå·å¸‚", "dataValue": "åœ°çº§å¸‚"}, {"name": "æ¸­å—å¸‚", "dataValue": "åœ°çº§å¸‚"}, {"name": "å»¶å®‰å¸‚", "dataValue": "åœ°çº§å¸‚"}, {"name": "æ¦†æž—å¸‚", "dataValue": "åœ°çº§å¸‚"}, {"name": "æ±‰ä¸­å¸‚", "dataValue": "åœ°çº§å¸‚"}, {"name": "å®‰åº·å¸‚", "dataValue": "åœ°çº§å¸‚"}, {"name": "å•†æ´›å¸‚", "dataValue": "åœ°çº§å¸‚"}]}, "width": 1000, "height": 1000}.

colors.description: Data color list, in rgb or rgba format.

dataType.description: The type of the data value, numeric or enumeration type

dataValue.description: Data value, numeric string or enumeration string.

name.description: Keywords for the Chinese name of an administrative region (must be within China), and must be one of China, province, city, district, or county. The name should be more specific and add attributive descriptions, for example, "è¥¿å®‰å¸‚" is better than "è¥¿å®‰", "æ­å·žè¥¿æ¹–åŒº" is better than "è¥¿æ¹–åŒº". It cannot be a specific place name or a vague name, such as "å…¶å®ƒ".

servers.server_description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) is a new, standardized protocol for managing context between large language models (LLMs) and external systems. In this repository, you can find several MCP servers allowing you to connect to Cloudflare's service from an MCP client (e.g. Cursor, Claude) and use natural language to accomplish tasks through your Cloudflare account.
servers.server_summary: Lets you use Claude Desktop, or any MCP Client, to use natural language to accomplish things on your Cloudflare account.

tools.tool_description: Search and retrieve relevant Cloudflare documentation for products and features. Obtain semantically similar results to answer questions on Workers, Zero Trust, CDN, and more.
Automate migration of Pages projects to Workers using natural language commands on Cloudflare. Follow the guide to ensure proper setup and execution.

servers.server_description: The Arize Phoenix MCP Server provides a unified interface for interacting with the Arize Phoenix platform.
servers.server_summary:
Phoenix MCP Server is an implementation of the Model Context Protocol for the Arize Phoenix platform. It provides a unified interface to Phoenix's capabilites.

You can use Phoenix MCP Server for:

Prompts Management: Create, list, update, and iterate on prompts
Datasets: Explore datasets, and synte

tools.tool_description: Retrieve the most recent version of a prompt, including its template, model configuration, and invocation parameters, for consistent and up-to-date prompt deployment.
Retrieve dataset examples, including inputs, outputs, and metadata, to test or benchmark application or model changes. Provides structured data for analysis and validation.
Retrieve a specific prompt version by its ID to access its template, model configuration, and invocation parameters using the Phoenix MCP Server.
Create or update prompts with customizable templates and configurations, including model settings. Ideal for managing and iterating on prompt-based workflows efficiently.
Retrieve all versions of a specific prompt with pagination support, providing IDs, configurations, and template details for version management.
Assign tags to specific prompt versions for better organization and tracking within the Phoenix MCP Server, ensuring clear identification and management of prompt iterations.
Retrieve detailed experiment metadata and results by ID, including outputs, annotations, and evaluator scores for analysis and comparison.
Retrieve a comprehensive list of datasets, including metadata like names, descriptions, and timestamps, to facilitate experiment inputs and dataset exploration.

tools.tool_description: Define the base directory for indexing code repositories to enable search and analysis within the 'code-index-mcp' MCP server.

Perform advanced code searches with external tools like ripgrep, ag, or grep for enhanced performance. Supports case sensitivity, context lines, file patterns, and safe fuzzy matching for precise results.
Search and locate files in a project using glob patterns like *.py or **/*.js. Simplify code repository navigation with pattern-based file matching.
Extract key insights from a specific file, including line count, function/class definitions, import statements, and complexity metrics, for efficient code analysis and understanding.

Retrieve project settings details for efficient code repository management and analysis using the code-index-mcp server.
Sets up a temporary directory for storing index data in the code-index-mcp server, facilitating efficient code repository indexing and analysis.

servers.server_description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open protocol that enables seamless integration between LLM applications and external data sources and tools. gl.description: Parameter defines the country to use for the Google search. It's a two-letter country code. (e.g., us for the United States, uk for United Kingdom, or fr for France).

hl.description: Parameter defines the language to use for the Google search. It's a two-letter language code. (e.g., en for English, es for Spanish, or fr for French).

query.description: Parameter defines the query you want to search. You can use anything that you would use in a regular Google search. e.g. inurl:, site:, intitle:. We also support advanced search query parameters such as as_dt and as_eq.

spenderAddress.description: The contract address being approved to spend your tokens (e.g., a DEX or lending protocol)

tools.tool_description: Transfer ERC1155 tokens to a specified wallet address by signing a transaction with the owner's private key. Supports both fungible and non-fungible tokens across multiple networks, including BSC, Ethereum, and Base.

amount.description: The quantity of tokens to send (e.g., '1' for a single NFT or '10' for 10 fungible tokens)

network.description: Network name (e.g. 'bsc', 'opbnb', 'ethereum', 'base', etc.) or chain ID. Supports others main popular networks. Defaults to BSC mainnet.

privateKey.description: Private key of the token owner account in hex format (with or without 0x prefix). SECURITY: This is used only for transaction signing and is not stored.

toAddress.description: The recipient wallet address that will receive the tokens

tokenAddress.description: The contract address of the ERC1155 token collection (e.g., '0x76BE3b62873462d2142405439777e971754E8E77')

tokenId.description: The ID of the specific token to transfer (e.g., '1234')

tools.tool_description: Check the total number of NFTs owned by a wallet address in a specific collection. Provides NFT count without returning individual token IDs, supporting multiple networks.

network.description: Network name (e.g. 'bsc', 'opbnb', 'ethereum', 'base', etc.) or chain ID. Supports others main popular networks. Defaults to BSC mainnet.

ownerAddress.description: The wallet address to check the NFT balance for (e.g., '0x1234...')

tokenAddress.description: The contract address of the NFT collection (e.g., '0xBC4CA0EdA7647A8aB7C2061c2E118A18a936f13D' for Bored Ape Yacht Club)

tools.tool_description: Retrieve the balance of a specific ERC1155 token ID for a given owner address. Specify the token contract address, token ID, and owner wallet to query balances across supported networks.

network.description: Network name (e.g. 'bsc', 'opbnb', 'ethereum', 'base', etc.) or chain ID. Supports others main popular networks. Defaults to BSC mainnet.

ownerAddress.description: The wallet address to check the token balance for (e.g., '0x1234...')

tokenAddress.description: The contract address of the ERC1155 token collection (e.g., '0x76BE3b62873462d2142405439777e971754E8E77')

tokenId.description: The ID of the specific token to check the balance for (e.g., '1234')

tools.tool_description: Retrieve block details by specifying the block number and network for BNB Chain or other supported networks. Defaults to BSC mainnet if no network is provided.

blockNumber.description: The block number to look up

network.description: Network name (e.g. 'bsc', 'opbnb', 'ethereum', 'base', etc.) or chain ID. Supports others main popular networks. Defaults to BSC mainnet.

servers.server_description: An MCP server designed to facilitate interaction between Large Language Models (LLMs) and the BoldSign API. The Model Context Protocol (MCP) extends LLM capabilities, enabling them to act as agents when connecting with external systems.
servers.server_summary: The BoldSign MCP server enables integration with the BoldSign API to manage e-signature

tools.tool_description: Send reminders to signers for pending document signatures via email. Specify document ID, recipient emails, and custom messages to ensure timely completion of signature requests.

documentId.description: Required. The unique identifier (ID) of the document to send a reminder email to signers for pending signatures.

items.description: Custom message content for the reminder email.

message.description: Optional. Message to be sent in the reminder email. If not provided, the system will use a default reminder message.

items.description: Email address of the sender.

onBehalfOf.description: Optional. Email address of the sender when creating a document on their behalf. This email can be retrieved from the `behalfOf` property in the get document or list documents tool.

items.description: Email address of the signer.

receiverEmails.description: Optional. One or more signer email addresses to send reminders for pending signatures. If multiple signers are required to sign the document, specify their email addresses. If there is not emails provided, it will send reminder to all pending signers.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve and filter BoldSign templates by page number, size, search key, type, creator, labels, creation date range, or brand IDs for precise template management.

items.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the brand to be used for depicting a brand.

brandIds.description: Optional. Filters templates associated with the specified brand IDs.

items.description: Email address of the template creator.

createdBy.description: Optional. Filters templates based on the email address(es) of their creators.

endDate.description: Optional. Filters templates created on or before this date (in YYYY-MM-DD format).

page.description: Required. The page number to retrieve the templates list. Used for pagination to navigate through the list of available templates.

pageSize.description: Optional. Specifies the number of templates to retrieve per page. The value must be an integer between 1 and 100. If not provided, the BoldSign API defaults to a page size of 10.

searchKey.description: Optional. A search key to filter templates by properties such as name and email address. Provides a way to refine results based on specific criteria.

startDate.description: Optional. Filters templates created on or after this date (in YYYY-MM-DD format).

items.description: Label of the template.

templateLabels.description: Optional. Filters templates based on associated labels (tags).

templateType.description: Optional. Filters templates based on their type (all, mytemplates, sharedtemplate). Defaults to 'all'.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve specific contact details using a unique ID for signer information in BoldSign. Ideal for managing document signatures and ensuring accurate signer data.

id.description: Required. The unique identifier (ID) of the contact to retrieve. This can be obtained from the list contacts tool.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve and manage a paginated list of contacts from your BoldSign organization. Filter by search term, specify page number, and choose between personal or organizational contacts for efficient signer detail management.

contactType.description: Optional. Filters the list of contacts based on their type. 'MyContacts' retrieves contacts specifically associated with your account, while 'AllContacts' (default) retrieves all accessible contacts within your organization.

page.description: Required. The page number of the contact list to retrieve. Used for pagination to navigate through the list of available contacts.

pageSize.description: Optional. Specifies the maximum number of contact records to be retrieved per page. If not provided, a default page size will be used by the BoldSign API. The value must be between 1 and 100. The default value is 10.

searchKey.description: Optional. A string used to filter the contact list. The API will return contacts whose details contain this search term.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve detailed properties of a BoldSign document, including status, metadata, sender and signer details, form fields, and history, by providing the unique document ID. Access is restricted to authorized users.

documentId.description: Required. The unique identifier (ID) of the document to retrieve. This can be obtained from the list documents tool.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve and manage a paginated list of documents with details like status, sender, recipient, and creation date. Filter by search terms, sender, recipient, labels, or date ranges for efficient document navigation.

items.description: Unique identifier (ID) of the brand.

brandIds.description: Optional. Filters documents based on associated brand IDs. Only documents linked to the specified brands will be retrieved.

dateFilterType.description: Optional. Type of date filter applied to documents. Available options: 'SentBetween' and 'Expiring'.

endDate.description: Optional. End transmit date range of the document. The date should be in a valid date-time format.

items.description: Label of the document.

labels.description: Optional. Labels associated with documents. Used to filter the list by specific document tags.

nextCursor.description: Optional. Cursor value for pagination beyond 10,000 records. Set to the cursor of the last retrieved document.

page.description: Required. The page number to retrieve, starting from 1. Used for pagination to navigate through the list of available documents.

pageSize.description: Optional. The maximum number of documents to display per page. Defaults to 10 but can be set between 1 and 100.

items.description: Email address of the signer.

recipients.description: Optional. Filter documents by signer email addresses. One or more signer email IDs can be specified.

searchKey.description: Optional. A search term used to filter the document list. The API will return documents matching details like document title, document ID, sender name, or recipient name.

items.description: Email address of the sender.

sentBy.description: Optional. Filter documents by sender email addresses. One or more sender email IDs can be specified.

startDate.description: Optional. Start transmit date range of the document. The date should be in a valid date-time format.

status.description: Optional. Filter documents based on their current status. Available statuses include 'WaitingForMe', 'WaitingForOthers', 'NeedAttention', 'Completed', 'Declined', 'Revoked', 'Expired', 'Scheduled', and 'Draft'. Use 'None' to disable status filtering.

transmitType.description: Optional. Type of transmission. Can be 'Sent', 'Received', or 'Both'.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve and filter a paginated list of team documents in BoldSign by status, user ID, team ID, date range, or document details. Admins access sent and received documents across the organization.

items.description: Unique identifier (ID) of the brand.

brandIds.description: Optional. Filters documents based on associated brand IDs. Only documents linked to the specified brands will be retrieved.

dateFilterType.description: Optional. Type of date filter applied to documents. Available options: 'SentBetween' and 'Expiring'.

endDate.description: Optional. End transmit date range of the document. The date should be in a valid date-time format.

items.description: Label of the document.

labels.description: Optional. Labels associated with documents. Used to filter the list by specific document tags.

nextCursor.description: Optional. Cursor value for pagination beyond 10,000 records. Set to the cursor of the last retrieved document.

page.description: Required. The page number to retrieve, starting from 1. Used for pagination to navigate through the list of available team documents.

pageSize.description: Optional. The maximum number of team documents to display per page. Defaults to 10 but can be set between 1 and 100.

searchKey.description: Optional. A search term used to filter the document list. The API will return documents matching details like document title, document ID, sender name, or recipient name.

startDate.description: Optional. Start transmit date range of the document. The date should be in a valid date-time format.

status.description: Optional. Filter documents based on their current status. Available statuses include 'WaitingForMe', 'WaitingForOthers', 'NeedAttention', 'Completed', 'Declined', 'Revoked', 'Expired', 'Scheduled', and 'Draft'. Use 'None' to disable status filtering.

items.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the team.

teamId.description: Optional. Filter documents based on specific teams. One or more team IDs can be specified.

transmitType.description: Optional. Type of transmission. Can be 'Sent', 'Received', or 'Both'.

items.description: The unique identifier (ID) of a user in the team.

userId.description: Optional. Filter documents based on the list of team member IDs. One or more user IDs can be specified.

tools.tool_description: Retrieve team details, including name, users, and creation/modification dates, by specifying the unique team ID in BoldSign organization. Access team-specific properties for effective management.

teamId.description: Required. The unique identifier (ID) of the team to retrieve. This can be obtained from the list teams tool.

cookie.description: The cookie of the browser, eg: "[{"domain":".baidu.com","expirationDate":"","name":"","path":"/","sameSite":"unspecified","secure":true,"value":"","id":1}]"

country.description: The country of the browser, eg: "CN"

domainName.description: The domain name of the browser, eg: facebook.com

fingerprintConfig.description: The fingerprint config of the browser, default is automatic_timezone: 0, timezone: "", language: [], flash: "", fonts: [], webrtc: disabled, browser_kernel_config: ua_auto, random_ua: ua_version: [], ua_system_version: [], tls_switch: 0, tls: ""

automatic_timezone.description: The automatic timezone of the browser, default is 0

browser_kernel_config.description: The browser kernel config of the browser, default is version: ua_auto, type: chrome

type.description: The type of the browser, default is chrome

version.description: The version of the browser, default is ua_auto

flash.description: The flash of the browser, default is disabled

fonts.description: The fonts of the browser, eg: ["Arial", "Times New Roman"]

language.description: The language of the browser, eg: ["en-US", "zh-CN"]

random_ua.description: The random ua config of the browser, default is ua_version: [], ua_system_version: []

ua_system_version.description: The ua system version of the browser, eg: ["Android 9", "iOS 14"]

timezone.description: The timezone of the browser, eg: Asia/Shanghai

tls.description: The tls of the browser, default is ""

tls_switch.description: The tls switch of the browser, default is 0

webrtc.description: The webrtc of the browser, default is disabled

groupId.description: The group id of the browser, must be a valid group id, if not, you can use the get-group-list tool to get the group list or create a new group

name.description: The name of the browser, eg: "My Browser"

openUrls.description: The open urls of the browser, eg: ["https://www.google.com"]

password.description: The password of the browser, eg: "password"

storageStrategy.description: The storage strategy of the browser, default is 0

sysAppCateId.description: The sys app cate id of the browser, you can use the get-application-list tool to get the application list

userProxyConfig.description: The user proxy config of the browser

global_config.description: The global config of the browser, default is 0

proxy_host.description: The proxy host of the browser, eg: 127.0.0.1

proxy_password.description: The proxy password of the browser, eg: password

proxy_port.description: The proxy port of the browser, eg: 8080

proxy_soft.description: The proxy soft of the browser

proxy_url.description: The proxy url of the browser, eg: http://127.0.0.1:8080

proxy_user.description: The proxy user of the browser, eg: user

username.description: The username of the browser, eg: "user"

parsing depth
optional field

full name of the location
required field
Location format - hierarchical, comma-separated (from most specific to least)

required field

example:
"targets": [
"forbes.com",

"bbc.com",
"yelp.com",
"https://www.apple.com/iphone/",
"https://ahrefs.com/blog/",
"ibm.com",
"https://variety.com/",
"https://stackoverflow.com/",
"www.trustpilot.com"
]

required field
you can set up to 1000 domains, subdomains or webpages
the domain or subdomain should be specified without https:// and www.
the page should be specified with absolute URL (including http:// or https://)
example:
"targets": [
"forbes.com",
"cnn.com",
"bbc.com",
"yelp.com",
"https://www.apple.com/iphone/",
"https://ahrefs.com/blog/",
"ibm.com",
"https://variety.com/",
"https://stackoverflow.com/",
"www.trustpilot.com"
]

tools.tool_description: Analyze competitors by identifying websites that share backlinks with your target domain, providing insights into backlink intersections and competitor rankings for strategic SEO optimization.

exclude_internal_backlinks.description:
indicates if internal backlinks from subdomains to the target will be excluded from the results
if set to true, the results will not include data on internal backlinks from subdomains of the same domain as target
if set to false, internal links will be included in the results

exclude_large_domains.description:
indicates whether large domain will appear in results
if set to true, the results from the large domain (google.com, amazon.com, etc.) will be omitted

filters.description:
array of results filtering parameters
optional field
you can add several filters at once (8 filters maximum)
you should set a logical operator and, or between the conditions
the following operators are supported:
regex, not_regex, =, <>, in, not_in, like, not_like, ilike, not_ilike, match, not_match
you can use the % operator with like and not_like to match any string of zero or more characters
example:
["rank",">","100"]
[["target","like","%forbes%"],
"and",
[["rank",">","100"],"or",["intersections",">","5"]]]
        availiable fields for filter:
        target
rank
intersections

limit.description: the maximum number of returned domains

main_domain.description:
indicates if only main domain of the target will be included in the search
if set to true, only the main domain will be included in search

offset.description:
offset in the results array of returned networks
optional field
default value: 0
if you specify the 10 value, the first ten domains in the results array will be omitted and the data will be provided for the successive pages

order_by.description:
results sorting rules
optional field
you can use the same values as in the filters array to sort the results
possible sorting types:
asc â€“ results will be sorted in the ascending order
desc â€“ results will be sorted in the descending order
you should use a comma to set up a sorting type
example:
["rank,desc"]
note that you can set no more than three sorting rules in a single request
you should use a comma to separate several sorting rules
example:
["intersections,desc","rank,asc"]

target.description:
domain, subdomain or webpage to get backlinks for
        required field
a domain or a subdomain should be specified without https:// and www.
a page should be specified with absolute URL (including http:// or https://)

tools.tool_description: Analyze backlink metrics for a target domain over a specified date range. Group data by day, week, month, or year to track link-building progress and create time-series visualizations.

date_from.description:
starting date of the time range
optional field
this field indicates the date which will be used as a threshold for summary data;
minimum value: 2019-01-30
maximum value shouldnâ€™t exceed the date specified in the date_to
date format: "yyyy-mm-dd"
example:
"2021-01-01"

date_to.description:
ending date of the time range
optional field
if you donâ€™t specify this field, the todayâ€™s date will be used by default
minimum value shouldnâ€™t preceed the date specified in the date_from
maximum value: todayâ€™s date
date format: "yyyy-mm-dd"
example:
"2021-01-15"

group_range.description:
time range which will be used to group the results
optional field
default value: month
possible values: day, week, month, year
note: for day, we will return items corresponding to all dates between and including date_from and date_to;
for week/month/year, we will return items corresponding to full weeks/months/years, where each item will indicate the last day of the week/month/year

for example, if you specify:
"group_range": "month",
"date_from": "2022-03-23",
"date_to": "2022-05-13"
we will return items falling between 2022-03-01 and 2022-05-31, namely, three items corresponding to the following dates: 2022-03-31, 2022-04-30, 2022-05-31

if there is no data for a certain day/week/month/year, we will return 0

domain to get data for

a domain should be specified without https:// and www.

"forbes.com"

servers.server_description: pure.md lets your scripts, APIs, apps, agents, etc reliably access web content in markdown format -- simply prefix any URL with pure.md/. It avoids bot detection and renders JavaScript for SPAs, and can convert HTML, PDFs, images, and more into pure markdown. Like a CDN for markdown content, it globally caches responses for future requests to the same resource, relieving stress on origin web servers.

tools.tool_description: Enables AI clients to retrieve web content in markdown format by searching specific queries, facilitating access to web information directly within supported platforms.
Access blocked web content by converting URLs into markdown format using the pure.md MCP server, enabling AI clients to retrieve and process information efficiently.

servers.server_description: SushiMCP is a model context protocol server designed to assist developers with delivering context to their AI IDE's. It's simple to use and massively improves the performance of base and premium LLM models when generating code. The easiest way to get started is by registering SushiMCP with your client using the default configuration:
servers.server_summary: SushiMCP is a model context protocol server that is designed to assist developers with delivering context to their AI IDE's. It's a simple to use and tool that massively improves the performance of base and premium LLM models when generating code.

tools.tool_description: Lists source URLs for fetching llms.txt files. Helps identify the best file (llms.txt, llms-full.txt, or llms-mini.txt) for specific technologies. Optionally suggests non-MCP tools for undiscovered documentation.
Fetch and process LLMs.txt file content to locate documentation or reference links. Use to streamline access to distributed LLM information across multiple URLs.

servers.server_description: This is a TypeScript-based MCP server that provides web scraping capabilities using the UseScraper API. It exposes a single tool 'scrape' that can extract content from web pages in various formats.
servers.server_summary: A TypeScript-based MCP server utilizing the UseScraper API to provide web scraping capabilities, allowing users to extract content from webpages in various formats.

tools.tool_description: Scrape webpage content in text, HTML, or markdown format using advanced proxy options to bypass bot detection and extract specific data with ease.

advanced_proxy.description: Use advanced proxy to circumvent bot detection (default: false)

extract_object.description: Optional object specifying data to extract

format.description: Format to save crawled page content. Strongly recommended to keep as markdown for optimal AI processing (default: markdown)

url.description: URL to scrape
